She needs the loan to buy sweaters in a variety of colors and sizes because Mother's Day is approaching (27 May in Bolivia) and her sales tend to go up when she offers new types of clothes.

Celia's dream is to have her own store.

This is the first time she's requesting a loan from IMPRO and the first time from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy sweaters

loans.name: Sahid

texts.en:
Sahid comes from East Java, but lives in Bali. He came to Bali in 1990. 

The first time he came, he worked as a laborer. After three years, he worked as a scavenger because the price for junk is very high. From this job, he can send money to his wife and children, who still live in Java. This business allowed Sahid to save and also buy a motorcycle.

Now Sahid has a new business. With his motorcycle, he travels to find junk and also sells handicrafts. He will use the loan to purchase more handicrafts to sell around the city. He hopes he can travel in wider areas and earn more profit. 

He dreams he can buy a house and bring his family to live in Bali.

loans.use: to purchase more handicrafts to sell around the city.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a 46 year old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She is engaged in fishing business together with her husband for more than 4 years now. Her husband works as a fisherman.
Angelina is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead wieghts, hooks and others. Through this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead wieghts, hooks and others

loans.name: Baby Zenda

texts.en:
Baby Zenda is a 49 year old married woman and a mother of two children from Talibon, Bohol. She runs a food (roasted chicken or lechon manok) business in her place for more than 10 years now. 
Baby Zenda is asking for a loan to buy more dressed chicken, seasonings, oil and others. Through this, she will be able to attract more buyers in her store thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more dressed chicken, seasonings, oil and others

loans.name: Benjamin Sr.

texts.en:
Benjamin Sr. is a fisherman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. He is a married man and has six children. Bejamin Sr. has been engaged in fishing business for more than 15 years now. He also sells food to the people in his place together with his wife.
Benjamin Sr. is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and ingredients for food vending like meat, vegetables, cooking oil and others. This loan would help him improve their business as well as their income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and ingredients for food vending like meat, vegetables, cooking oil and others

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a fish vendor from Bohol, a province in the Philippines. She has been in the business for more than 2 years now. This is the source of her income. Conchita works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of family. 
Conchita is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell . Through this, Conchita will be able to increase her sales and profit.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a milled rice retailer in her place in Talibon, Bohol. She is a a widow and has two grown up children.
 Edna has been engaged in the business for several years now. This is the source of her income.
Edna is asking for a loan to buy more rice to sell . Through this, she will be able to sell more and augment her income. Edna dreams of improving her business and makes it a success.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en:
This is Analisa. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of their 'tricycle'. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time of 10,000 PHP to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their 'tricycle'. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to cover their daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nenita hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and accessories and to pay for maintenance on their 'tricycle'.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
This is Riza, 33, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Anthony and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Riza operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Riza dreams that her business will be more successful and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 34 years old. She is married and blessed with two kids. They live together in Magsaysay, Baliangao. 

Joan has a shop that sells grocery items. She has been this business for two years. Joan earns 3200 PHP monthly for this activity. Joan requested a new loan of 10,000 PHP to be used to purchase 10 boxes of assorted groceries to sell. Joan has been a member of Paglaum MPC for five years.

loans.use: To purchase 10 boxes of assorted grocery items

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
This is Letecia. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more products such as biscuits and dried fish. This helped her in her everyday expenditures. She has been running this business for thirteen years already. She keeps on working to provide for her everyday expenses and to be able to help her family.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time of 20,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock of biscuits and dried fish needed in her business. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her cover her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Leticia dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that that she will have a happy and a beautiful life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of biscuits and dried fish needed for her business.

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en: Edwina is a married woman and and a mother of three young children. They live in Getafe, Bohol. Edwina is engaged in fishing business with her husband for more than 4 years now. This is the source of their income. Edwina is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and hooks . Through this loan, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and hooks

loans.name: Emilda

texts.en:
Emilda is a fish vendor (fresh and dried) from the town of Getafe, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in the business for more than 4 years now. This is the source of her income.
Emilda is asking for a loan to buy more fish for drying . Emilda dreams of making her business a success and more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more fish for drying

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a farmer from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is a married woman and has three children. Evangeline is a hardworking woman and has been in the farming business for more than 5 years now. She helps her husband in tilling their farm.
Evangeline is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.Through this, they will be able to improve their  farm as well as their harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 50 year old married woman and a mother of five children from Talibon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or variety store selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Grace is also engaged in  selling of seafood products like oyster and others.
Grace is asking for a loan to buy more stocks for the store like canned goods, candies, noodles, and sea oyster. Through this, she will be able to improve her stocks and augment her profit and income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks for the store like canned goods, candies, noodles, and sea oyster

loans.name: Jeraldin

texts.en:
Jeraldin  is a married woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is engaged in hog raising business and has been in the business for more than 3 years now. Her husband is a fisherman.
Jeraldin is asking for a loan to buy feeds for the pigs. Through this, she will be able to improve her hog raising business and augment her income. Jeraldin dreams of expanding her business and makes it a success.

loans.use: to buy feeds for the pigs

loans.name: Lecilda

texts.en:
Lecilda is a married woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She and her husband are engaged in fishing business for several years now.
Lecilda is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and to pay the school expenses of children. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch and they can also support the schooling of their children.
In the future, Lecilda dreams of making her business a success and more productive.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and to pay the school expenses of children

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is a farmer from the Bohol, Philippines. She has been investing in her rice field for several years now. She helps her husband in tilling their lot as well.
Luciana is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm . With it, they will be able to improve their farm and increase their harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Madonna

texts.en:
Madona is a married woman and a mother of a 2 month old baby from Getafe, Bohol. She is engaged in fish vending business for more than 2 years now. This is the source of her income.
Madona is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell . In the future, Madona dreams of making her business a success and a stable source of her income.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 39 year old married woman and a mother of four children. They live in Getafe, Bohol. Maria earns a living through her fish vending business. Her husband is a fisherman.
Maria is requesting for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others. Through this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta is a 40 year old married woman and a mother of two children from Getafe, Bohol. Modesta is engaged in hog raising and good vending business. Her husband is a carpenter and a fisherman at the same time.
Modesta is asking for a loan to buy feeds for the pigs and additional capital to purchase a fishing boat. Through this loan,they will be able to improve their business as well as their income.

loans.use: to buy feeds for the pigs and additional capital to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is a married man and a father of six grown up children from Getafe, Bohol. Ruben is engaged in food vending business for more than 15 years now together with his wife.
Ruben is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for food vending like meat, vegetables, cooking oil and seasonings. Through this, he will be able to cook and sell more food to his customers in his place. In the future, Ruben dreams of expanding his business in order to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food vending like meat, vegetables, cooking oil and seasonings

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en: Shiela earns a living through her hat making business. She lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She has been in the business for more than 2 years now. This is the source of her income. Shiela is asking for a loan to buy materials for hat making like buri or native palm, straw and others. Through this, she will be able to make more hats and sell it to the market at a good price.

loans.use: to buy materials for hat making like buri, straw and others

loans.name: Teodola

texts.en:
Teodola earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business. She is also engaged in fish vending business. Teodola lives with her family in the town of Getafe, Bohol.
Teodola is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, candies, sugar, and noodles and fish to sell. Through this, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, candies, sugar, and noodles and fish to sell

loans.name: Walter

texts.en: Walter is a fisherman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. He is a married man and has been in the business for more than 27 years now. Walter is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat. Through this loan ,he will be able to improve his fishing venture and augment his income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en: Wilfreda earns a living through her fishing business together with her husband for more than 10 years now.This is the source of their income. Wilfreda is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others. Through this, her husband will be able to improve his catch and sell more fish to the market. In the future, Wilfreda dreams of making their business a success.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others

loans.name: Zelyn

texts.en: Zelyn runs a sari-sari or variety store selling various goods and items to the people in her place in Getafe, Bohol. Zelyn is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, rice, soda, noodles, soap and toiletries . Through this, she will be able to attract and cater more buyers in her store thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, rice, soda, noodles, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en: Celsa earns a living through her basket weaving business. She lives with her family in the town of Antequera, Bohol. Celsa is also  engaged in food vending business. Celsa is asking for a loan to buy materials for basket weaving like buri or native palm, nito and straw and ingredients for food vending like flour, egg, cooking oil and others. With this, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy materials for basket weaving like buri, nito and straw and ingredients for food vending like flour, egg, cooking oil and others

loans.name: Firma

texts.en:
Firma is engaged in fish vending business. She lives with her family in Maribojoc, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in the business for more than 20 years now. Her husband is a farmer and a fisherman. 
Firma is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets .
In the future, Firma hopes of expanding her business and makes it a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Floramae

texts.en:
Floramae is a basket weaver from the town of Antequera, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of two young children. Floramae has been in the business for more than five years now. Floramae works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family.
Floramae is asking for a loan to buy materials for basket weaving like buri, nito, straw and others. Through this, she will be able to weave more baskets and sell it to the market at a very good price. 
Floramae hopes of making her business a success someday and saves money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy materials for basket weaving like buri, nito, straw and others

loans.name: Yessenia

texts.es: La señora Yessenia es una madre soltera que tiene una hija de 4 años, la señora vive en la casa de su madre en una zona muy alejada y lejos  del centro urbano. La señora se dedica al comercio de ropa para poder conseguir el sustento diario de ella y de su pequeña hija, ella quiere poder incrementar sus ingresos en su actividad, por esta razón la señora Yessenia necesita el préstamo para poder comprar un poco mas de mercadería y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su pequeña familia, y de esta manera algún día también soñar con una vivienda propia más adelante
texts.en: Yessenia’s a single mother; she has a four-year-old daughter.  She lives in her mother’s house in a zone that’s quite far and isolated from the urban center.  She works selling clothes to earn daily sustenance for her and her little girl.  She wants to be able to increase income from her activity which is why Yessenia needs the loan to buy a bit more merchandise and be able thus to improve her and her small family’s quality of life.  She will also be able this way to someday dream with having a house of her own later on.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Ariungerel

texts.en:
Mrs. Ariungerel, 35 years old, lives with her husband and children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. They live in their own apartment.  She has been running a clothing sales business since 2009 and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in importing clothes from China, collecting materials used for customs and selling clothing. Her husband has been driving customers to their destination between Ulaanbaatar and other cities for four years using his own automobile.

 In 2013, they purchased their apartment which had deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair. So she is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as gypsum, hardwood floors, fiberglass and foam. Using these materials, her husband can repair and insulate their apartment. As a result, the family can live in a comfortable and warm place which will enable the family to conserve energy and contribute to energy efficiency. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Elissa

texts.en:
Elissa is 60 years old, married and blessed with three children. She lives in Pta. Miray, Baliangao. To make a living, Elissa has been engaged in food vending. She is able to earn 2400 PHP a month for this business. She has been doing this kind of activity for seven years. 

Elissa is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase construction materials needed for house repair. Elissa has been a member of Paglaum MPC for almost 10 years.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for house repair

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
This is Araceli. She previously accessed a 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Araceli dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes to always have good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise, including clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza is married and blessed with three children. She is 44 years old and lives in Magsaysay, Baliangao. Liza grows corn and rice as a source of income. She has been doing this activity for 15 years and earns a monthly income of 3200 PHP. Liza is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase 10 sacks of assorted fertilizer for rice and corn production. Liza has been a member of Paglaum MPC for almost 10 years.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sacks of fertilizer for rice and corn production

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en: Ailyn is a 30 year old married woman from Ubay,Bohol.She has 3 children. The oldest is 8 while the youngest is 4. She engage in farming. She grows rice. She has been growing rice for  almost 5 years from now. Aside from farming, She also sells fish.Her husband is a fisher man. Ailyn requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy fertilizers for the rice field and fishing materials like fishing net and nylon. In the future, Ailyn would like to expand her business to support her family with proper diets as well as to finance her  children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the rice field and fishing materials like fishing net and nylon

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is a merchant and runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place in Maribojoc, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of four children. Lorna is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to attract and cater more buyers in her store thus augmenting her sales and profit. In the future, Lorna dreams of expanding her store so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family especially for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia is a 46 year old married woman from Carlos P. Garcia, Bohol. She is a mother of a 6 year old son. She engage in mat weaving. She mats mat made of buri (palm) leaves. Aside from mat weaving, Alicia also engage in fishing. Her husband is a fisherman. She is the one who sells the catch of her husband. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy materials needed  in renovating the pump boat. In the future, future, Alicia would like to expand her both business in order to save for her child's education at the same time provide proper diets for the whole family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed  in renovating the pump boat

loans.name: Alona

texts.en: Alona is a 38 year old married woman from Carlos P. Garcia, Bohol. She has 3 children. The oldest child is 11 while the youngest is 4. She engage in fish vending.She sells fish to her community. Sometimes, She also sells smoke fish in a stick.She has been into food vending for 10 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy  more fish to sell to attract more customers. In the future, Alona would like to expand her fish vending business to be able to support her family and to finance her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita is a married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has 4 children. The oldest child is 24 while the youngest is 16.She owns and operates a retail store business. She sells commodities like noodles, canned goods, shampoos, sugar,coffee and soft drinks. Anecita requested a loan of 5,00 PHP to buy more groceries to sell beverages, canned goods, soft drinks, and  toiletries. In the future, Anecita would like to expand her business to support her family and to continue finance her children to college education.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like  beverages, canned goods, soft drinks, and  toiletries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks for cosmetics sale like perfume, deodorant, make up , cologne and others

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en: Diosdada is a 62 year married woman from Ubay, Bohol.She has 3 children. She engage in buy and sell business. She sells dried fish, vegetables and spices. She has been into buy and sell business for 12 years. She requested loan of 19,000 PHP to buy more vegetables, seasonings, and dried fish, to attract more customers. In the future, Diosdada would like to expand her business to improve their livelihood status and also to finance the education of her children.

loans.use: to  buy more vegetables, seasonings, and dried fish

loans.name: Maredel

texts.en: Maredel is a 36 year old married woman and a mother of three children from Sikatuna, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business in her place selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Maredel is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. Through this, she will be able to improve her store thus augmenting her sales and income. Maredel dreams of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Dulcesima

texts.en: Dulcesima is a 53 year old married woman from Carlos P. Garcia,Bohol.She has 4 grown children.She operates a retail store. She sells commodities like sugar, eggs, cooking oil, canned goods, and noodles.She has been operating a retail store business for almost 15 years.She requested a loan of  29,000 PHP to buy additional stocks like rice, soft drinks and other groceries. In the future,  Dulcesima would like to expand her business to meet the family's daily needs as well as to save for the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, soft drinks and other groceries

loans.name: Efren

texts.en: Efren is a 41 year old married man from Carlos P. Garcia,Bohol. He has 2 children. The oldest child is 12 while the youngest is 3.He engage in motorcycle transport services. He transport customers from one barrio to another with a certain fee. He has been operating a motorcycle transport services for almost 5 years.Aside from motorcycle transport services, he engage in farming, he grows rice.Efren requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy motorcycle parts to avoid delayed and hassle free ride for his customers. In the future, Efren would like to  save for the education of his children for their bright future.

loans.use: to buy motor cycle spare parts

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 52 year old married woman from Carlos P.Garcia,Bohol. She has 5 children.  The oldest child is 23 while the youngest is 12.She operates a retail store business. She sells items such biscuits, noodles, canned goods,  She has been operating a retail store business for 10 years. She requested a  loan of  29,000 PHP to buy flour, beverages, toiletries, soft drinks and dry goods.  In the future, She would like to expand her business to continue send her children to school as well as  to improve their livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy flour, beverages, toiletries, sft drinks and dry goods

loans.name: Aguido

texts.en: Aguido is a farmer from Ubay, Bohol. He is a married man and has been in the farming business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of his income. Aguido is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm . Through this, he will be able to improve his farm as well as his harvest. In the future, Aguido hopes of making his farming business a success.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Erna

texts.en: Erna is a 48 year old married woman from Alicia,Bohol. She runs a mini pharmacy. She sells medicines. She has been operating a mini pharmacy for  years. Aside from  operating a mini pharmacy, She also engage in farming. She grows rice. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy various medicines and fertilizers and rice seedlings for her farm, for better harvest. In the future, Erna would like to expand her business in order  improve their livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy various medicines and fertilizers and rice seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en: Alfredo earns a living through his motorcycle transport business. He is a married man and a father of two children. Alfredo is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for the motorcycle like wheel tire, nuts and bolts, and others. With this, he will be able to maintain the good working condition of the vehicle and continue in using it for a living. Alfredo dreams of experiencing fullness of life together with his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the motorcycle like wheel tire, nuts and bolts, and others

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is a married woman and a mother of nine children from CPG, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari  or variety store and karaoke machine services.  She is also engaged in seaweed buying and selling business. Analyn is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned gods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. Through this, she will be able to augment her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned gods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Filrose

texts.en: Filrose is a  40 year old married woman from Ubay,Bohol.She has 4 children. The oldest child is 18 while the youngest is 6. She operates a retail store in her community. She sells items like bread, powdered milk, soft drinks and soaps. She has been operating a retail store for almost 4 years. His husband is a farmer. He grows rice. Filrose requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy rice, soft drinks and other goods to filled her store with  stocks and variety to choose from. In the future, Filrose would like to expand her retail store  business to provide proper diets and also to save for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy rice, soft drinks and other goods

loans.name: Eva Cristina

texts.es: La Sra. Eva llego al Beni junto con su familia en busca de mejores condiciones económicas, pero al no encontrarlas decidieron emigrar al Chapare, viviendo toda su niñez allí,  pero ella cuando salió bachiller con la ayuda económica de su hermano mayor decidió llegar a Quillacollo   con el único objetivo de continuar sus estudios, pero por factores que se le presentaron en su vida de juventud como madre soltera debido al abandono del padre de su hija ella asumió la responsabilidad de su hija sola y tuvo que dejar completamente sus estudios y dedicarse a trabajar; hace más de un año decidió abrir su negocio propio con sus ahorros, actualmente ella cuenta con un negocio de servicios de internet y llamadas nacionales e internacionales; ella desea mejorar el crecimiento de su negocio  ya que tiene pensado modernizar su negocio para brindar de esta manera un mejor servicio a sus clientes, atiende durante todo el día los siete días a la semana aprovechando que su hija todavía esta pequeña. Con el crédito quiere cambiar su sistema eléctrico e insumos y accesorios para su negocio.
texts.en:
Eva came to El Beni with her family in search of better economic conditions but not finding them they moved to El Chapare where she spent her entire childhood.  When she graduated high school with economic help from her brother she went to Quillacollo and her only objective was to complete her schooling but because of factors that came up in her life as a young single mother abandoned by her child’s father she took on the entire responsibility of raising her daughter alone and had to completely leave her schooling aside and start to work.

It’s been more than a year now since she decided to use her savings to open her own business.  She currently has a business providing Internet access, as well as national and international telephone calls.  She wants to improve the business’ growth because she plans to modernize it to provide better customer service.

She’s open seven days a week taking advantage of her daughter’s still being little.  She will use the loan to replace the electrical system and for supplies and accessories for her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Byambasuren, 28 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. She has been making Mongolian traditional clothes on her own for the last two years. Before this, she worked at a sewing factory and learned every necessary skill for making traditional Mongolian clothes. Her husband has a position of sample collector at a private business entity. 

The house they built four years ago and now live in has a brick furnace which doesn't fully heat the house. So Byambasuren is requesting a loan of 1,300,000 MNT to purchase a low pressure heater. After installing this low pressure heater, the family will burn less coal for heating and so they will release fewer pollutants into the air,  thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a low pressure heater

loans.name: Waris

texts.en:
Waris is 52 years old, a hard-working man. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan. He is a father of six children, three daughters and three sons. He is a milk seller by trade which is the only source of income for the family. He has two buffaloes and he sells their milk in the market. He is a poor old person and he has to do a lot of hard work because he is the only earning member of the family.

Presently he wants to purchase one more buffalo to grow his business and to increase his net income and savings as well. However due to the lack of expenses he finds it difficult. 

Therefore Waris has requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he can  purchase a buffalo. 

Waris is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a buffalo to sell its milk.

loans.name: Gayatri Indah Group

texts.en:
As a housewife who lives in the village, Ni Komang raises pigs in order to help her husband, who works as a laborer, and finance her three children. Ni Komang came back to MUK to borrow 2,000,000 IDR (Indonesian rupiah) for capital together with the Gayatri Indah group. Ni Komang plans to use this loan to buy four fattening piglets to be maintained for six months.

Ni Komang expects the price per kilo of pigs to go up and feed prices to go down in the next six months so that the benefits will be more than the previous period.

The profits will be used to finance her children's school fees and, of course, to raise the capital of the pig business.

loans.use: to buy four fattening piglets.

loans.name: Andres

texts.en:
Andres is a motorcycle driver from CPG, Bohol. Motorcycle is one of the transportation method in the region. Andres is a married man and a father of four grown up children.
Andres is asking for a loan to buy spare parts fro the motorcycle like wheel tire, chain, nuts and bolts. Through this, he will be able to improve his business and makes it a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts fro the motorcycle like wheel tire, chain, nuts and bolts

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en: Flaviana is a 60 year old married woman from Carlos P. Garcia,Bohol. She has 4 children. The oldest child is 30 while the youngest is 19.She engage in farming. She grows rice. She has been growing rice  for almost 20 years. Flaviana  requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fertilizers,rice seedlings and pesticide to improve the volume of harvest. In the future, Flaviana would like to expand her business to support the family's daily needs and to improve livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers,rice seedlings and pesticide

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita is a 60 year old woman from the town of CPG, Bohol. She is engaged in cattle raising business and fishing. Anecita needs a loan to buy new fishing nets and paint for the boat. Through this, she will be able to improve her business and augment her income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and paint for the boat

loans.name: Anesia

texts.en: Anesia is a mat weaver from the the town of CPG, Bohol. She is a married woman and has 2 grown up children. Anesia is asking for a loan to buy materials for mat weaving like romblon, dye, straw and others. Anesia is asking for a loan to buy materials for mat weaving like romblon or native palm, dye, straw and others . Through this, she will be able to weave more and sell it for a good price in the market. Anesia hopes of making  her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy materials for mat weaving like romblon, dye, straw and others

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en: Angeline is a 32 year old married woman and a mother of two children ages 10 and nine. Angeline runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Angeline is asking for a loan to buy additional groceries to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. Through this, she will be able to improve her business and cater more buyers in her store. Angeline dreams of expanding her business so that it will generate more income necessary for the needs of the family like for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is a 58 year old married woman from Ubay, Bohol.She has only 1 child and already grown. She runs a retail store. She sells coffee, soaps, sugar, flour, shampoo, and canned goods. She has been operating a retail store business for almost 10 years. Gloria  requested a loan of 22,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, beverages, and feeds for the pigs. In the future, Gloria would like to expand her business to improve her livelihood status and also save for the future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, beverages, feeds for the pigs

loans.name: Ann Marjorie

texts.en: Ann Marjorie earns a living through her hog raising business. She lives with her family in the town of CPG, Bohol. She has been in the business for more than 2 years now. This is the source of her income. Ann Marjorie is asking for a loan to buy feeds for the pigs. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her business and augment her income. Ann Marjorie dreams of experiencing fullness of life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds for the pigs

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is a fish vendor from the town of Anda, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of seven children. Antonio has been in the business for more than 10 years now.
Antonio is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell . With this, he will be able to  improve his sale and income. In the future, Antonio dreams of making his business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Helina

texts.en: Helina is a 44 year old married woman from Carlos P. Garcia, Bohol. She has 4 children. The oldest child is 25 while the youngest is 9. She engage in fishing. She sells fish. Her husband is a fisherman. Helina was the one who sells the catch of her husband. Helina requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy fishing materials like fishing net, lead weights, and nylon. In the future,Helina would like to expand her business to provide her family with proper diets and to save for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net, lead weights, and nylon

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli earns a living through her hog raising and mat weaving business. She lives with her family in the town of Ubay, Bohol. She has been in the business for more than 4 years now. This is the source of her income. 
Arceli is asking for a loan to buy feeds for the feeds for the pigs and materials for mat weaving like romblon or native palm and dye. Through this, she will be able to increase her income and profit. Moreover , she hopes to continue in supporting her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy feeds for the feeds for the pigs and materials for mat weaving like romblon and dye

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is a 43 year old fisherman from CPG, Bohol. He is married and has been fishing for a living for six years now. From this livelihood, he usually earns an average monthly income of 6000 PHP which help for food and household bills. Noel is asking for a loan of 6000 PHP to buy fishing net and fishing boat. He knows that this change will be helpful so he can have a better profit. 

In the future, he hopes to have children and give his family a good life.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and fishing boat

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 41 year old woman who is married with a 17 year old son. She and her family live in Mabini, Bohol. While her husband work as a School Security Guard, Nancy is into raising hogs and Sari-sari (variety) store business. Her businesses started four years ago to help meet the needs of her family. She is asking for a loan of 12000 PHP to buy feed, canned goods, toiletries, seasoning and noodles.  An additional capital will help so she can improve her inventory and income.
In the future, she would like to have a bigger store and piggery for a better business.

loans.use: to buy feed, canned goods, toiletries, seasoning and noodles

loans.name: Lanida

texts.en:
Lanida has a Sari-sari (variety) store business in the community of Alicia, Bohol. In her store she sells basic household items like soft drinks, chips, detergent, canned goods and seasoning. In addition to her store, she also do rice farming. These businesses helped in raising her family. She is asking for a loan of 6000 PHP to buy wine, soft drinks, toiletries, canned goods, chips and seasoning for better income. She is 40 years old, married with two children ages 16 years old. 

In the future, Lanida hopes to become a stock holder and have a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy wine, soft drinks, toiletries, canned goods, chips and seasoning

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Don Pablo proviene de familia con escasos recursos económicos, tiene 28 años. Don Pablo ha decidido comprar una parcela para poder trabajar con holgura y diversificar sus cultivos,  y así no tener producciones reducidas y estacionales, por las razones anteriormente mencionadas don Pablo ha recurrido al préstamo ya que es una oportunidad que le brindara beneficios para salir adelante. Como se puede apreciar en las fotos vive en una casa de adobe con revoque de barro mejorado con un depósito de alimentos rustico construido de ramas y palos que no garantizan el ingreso de roedores y otras plagas de la zona. El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de un terreno agrícola, lo cual le permitirá incrementar sus cultivos y por ende sus ingresos, de esta manera mejorara poco a poco su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Pablo comes from a family of scarce economic resources; he’s 28-years-old.  Pablo’s decided to buy a parcel of land to work with ease and diversify his crops so that his production won’t be limited or seasonal.  Because of the aforementioned reasons, Pablo has turned to a loan because it’s an opportunity that will result in benefits for him to move forward.  As can be appreciated in the photo, he lives in an adobe house covered in mud that’s been improved with a rustic depository for food that’s built of branches and sticks that don’t keep rodents and other local pests out.  The loan he’s asking for is to buy farmland so he can increase his crops and his income as a result; in this way he will gradually improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farmland.

loans.name: Pisila

texts.en:
"Pisila is 61 years old and married with 12 children. 
She has a small garden where she grows cabbage,tomato and cucumber that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for many years. Pisila needs a loan to buy manure chemical,vegetable seeds, fertilizer, rake, bushknives and digging stick for her business. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. Pisila will use the profits from her sales to help her family needs."

loans.use: to buy manure chemical,vegetable seeds, fertilizer, rake, bushknives and digging stick

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
"Nila is 26 years old and married with 3 children. 
She has a small garden where she grows vegetables that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 5 years. Nila needs a loan to buy different vegetables seeds, weeding fork, rakes and wheelbarrow. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. Nila will use the profits from her sales to support her family and to help stabilised her business so that she will rely on it every day."

loans.use: to buy different vegetable seeds, weeding fork, rakes and wheelbarrow

loans.name: Olioli

texts.en: Olioli is 40 years old and married with 6 childrens. She owns and operates a business venture, sewing business. She has 3 years of experience in this line of business. Olioli needs a loan to buy for a new sewing machine, fabrics and paints. She hopes to use her profits to support her family and to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2010.

loans.use: to buy  a new sewing machine, fabrics and paints

loans.name: Taape

texts.en: Taape is 51 years old and married with 3 children. She runs a small business selling vegestable in her community and has been doing this for many years. Taape has requested a loan to buy fertilizer,chemicals,timber,cement,iron roof and pay for children education. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Taape will provide her children education need and also help her family daily need.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer,chemicals,timber,cement,iron roof and pay for children education

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
"Rosalina is 36 years old and married with 5 childrens. 
She has a small garden where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for many years. Rosalina needs a loan to buy a weed killer, bush knives,barred wire,sack of fertilizer and iron roofing. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Rosalina will use the profits from her sales to improve her business and to support her family needs."

loans.use: to buy a weed killer, bush knives, sacks of fertilizer ,barred wire and iron roofing

loans.name: Aulagia

texts.en:
"Aulagia is 34 years old and married with 3 childrens. 
She has two businesses, a small garden where she grows taro and bananas and fishing that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for many 6 years. Aulagia needs a loan to buy fishing spears,sack of fertilizer,fishing goggles,spade,barred wire and iron roofing. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Aulagia will use the profits from her sales to improve her business and to support her family needs."

loans.use: to buy fishing spears,sack of fertilizer,fishing goggles,spade,barred wire and iron roofing

loans.name: Semeane

texts.en:
"Semeane is 65 years old and married with 11 children. 
She has a small garden where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for many years. Semeane needs a loan to buy a weed killer, bush knives, sacks of fertilizer and baby taro plant to help maintain her business . 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.Semeaane will use the profits from her sales to support her family and the business as well."

loans.use: to buy a weed killer, bush knives, sacks of fertilizer and baby taro plant

loans.name: Matalena

texts.en: Matalena is a 25 year old married woman with 3 children. She makes and sells ice cake and pop-corn in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Matalena needs a loan to buy a plastic cups,cordial, icebel, sack of sugar,pop corn and a deep freezer. She plans to use her profits to support her family. Matalena has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy plastic cups, cordial, icebel, sack of sugar, pop corn and a deep freezer.

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en: Telesia is a 33 year old married woman with 1 child. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Telesia needs a loan to buy a sacks of flour, sugar,vegetable oil, baking powder and a new stove to replace the old one.She plans to use her profits to improve her business and to help support her family needs. Telesia has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy a sacks of flour, sugar, vegetable oil, baking powder,and a new stove to replace the old one.

loans.name: Sale

texts.en: Sale is 50 years old and single with no children. She runs a small business selling varieties of handicrafts and elei in her community and has been doing this for many years. Sale has requested a loan to buy materials,painting, brushes, kava bowls, samoan earrings,fine mats and elei board for her business. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Sale will use to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials,painting, brushes, kava bowls, samoan earrings,fine mats and elei board

loans.name: Nuualuga

texts.en: Nuualuga is 36 years old and married with 2 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 1 year. Nuualuga has requested a loan to buy sugar, flour, baking soda and oil. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Nuualuga will use to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, baking soda and oil.

loans.name: Ema

texts.en: Ema is 21 years old and married with 1 child. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 1 year. Ema has requested a loan to buy flour,sugar, frying pan, baking soda and oil for her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Ema will use to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy flour,sugar, frying pan, baking soda and oil

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en: Doreen is 18 years old and single with no children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Doreen has requested a loan to buy fishing gears ,fishing line, fishing rod and fishing net. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Doreen will use to improve her current business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gears ,fishing line, fishing rod and fishing net.

loans.name: Mariafatima

texts.en: Mariafatima is 29 years old and married with 5 children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for many years. Mariafatima has requested a loan to buy fishing nets,fishing rod, fishing line ,hooks and spears. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Mariafatima will use for her family daily needs.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets,fishing rod, fishing line ,hooks and spears

loans.name: Fili

texts.en: Fili is 36 years old and married with 6 children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for 6 years. Fili has requested a loan to buy spears, nets, goggle and a canoe. She joined SPBD in  2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Fili will use to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy spears, nets, goggle and a canoe

loans.name: Sooaga

texts.en: Sooga is 27 years old and married with 2 children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for 3 years. Sooga has requested a loan to buy fishing net,fishing rod,fishing line and torch. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Sooga will use to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing net,fishing rod,fishing line and torch

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en:
"Elisapeta is a 25 year old married woman with 3 children. 
She has a small plantation and grows taro crops,banana crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Elisapeta has requested a loan to buy grass sprayer,chemicals,fertilizer,wheel barrow and spade for her business. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Elisapeta hopes to provide her family everyday need.

loans.use: to buy grass sprayer,chemicals,fertilizer,wheel barrow and spade

loans.name: Osana

texts.en:
"Osana is a 42 year old married woman with 6 children. 
She has a small plantation and grows taro crops,banana crops and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for 7 years. Osana has requested a loan to buy chemicals,fertilizer,wheelbarrow,grass sprayer,rake and digging spade for her business. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Osana hopes to expand her business.
"

loans.use: to buy chemicals,fertilizer,wheelbarrow,grass sprayer,rake and digging spade

loans.name: Geneveb

texts.en:
Geneveb is a 27 year old mother of two children ages 4 and eight. She is married and her husband works as a carpenter. Geneveb is helping her spouse by farming rice to generate an income. This is her source of livelihood for two years now. She is asking for a loan of 6000 PHP to buy a waterproof canvass that she can use to provide shade in the field to rest. This will enable her to relax during lunch breaks.
 

Her income will provide her family a better chance for the future, specially her children.
In the future, she hopes to have a bigger land to till and cultivate so she can earn more.

loans.use: to buy waterproof canvass

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a 33 year old woman from Mabini, Bohol. She is married with two children ages 5 and 8. She is engaged in Sari-sari store business for four years now. Alma is asking for a loan of 6000 PHP to buy stocks of detergent, seasoning, noodles, chips, biscuits and candies. She knows that an additional capital has a long way to go for her business profitability. Her income will help meet the needs of her children in terms of school fees and food.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and be more profitable.

loans.use: to buy stocks of detergent, seasoning, noodles, chips, biscuits and candies

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro is 54 years old from CPG, Bohol. CPG is an island where most people relies on fishing for a living. Alejandro is doing the same. He has been fishing for six years now. He is asking for a loan so he can continue to sustain his business. He will use his loan to buy fishing net and pay for fishing boat maintenance.
He works hard so he can live in comfort in his old age since his children are already grown.


In the future, he hopes to have a better business for a bigger profit.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and pay for fishing boat maintenance

loans.name: Osvaldo

texts.es: Don Osvaldo, 33 años, concubinado, tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad, una persona muy respetuosa y trabajadora. Actualmente el junto a su familia vive en la población de Shinahota, pagando alquiler de una casa pequeña. Don Osvaldo trabaja desde hace 5 años en el rubro del transporte, tiene su propia movilidad donde presta sus servicios dentro el mismo municipio y hace unos 2 años atrás se compro una radio FM con la cual también trabaja recibiendo contratos por programas o comunicados. Su esposa coopera generando ingresos por la venta de yuca que lleva a la ciudad de Cochabamba. Hace unos años atrás se compro un terreno en la misma población que actualmente ya está en construcción, pero por los costos no logro terminarla. Ahora el solicita un pequeño crédito para poder terminar dicha construcción, y vivir en su propio hogar más tranquilo al lado de su familia.
texts.en:
Osvaldo, 33, lives in a common-law marriage and has two children, ages 6 and 2.  He's a very respectful and hardworking person.  Currently he and his family live in the community of Shinahota and rent a small house.

Osvaldo has worked for five years in the field of transportation.  He has his own vehicle with which he offers services in the same town.  In addition, two years ago he bought an FM radio with which he also works, receiving contracts for programs or announcements.  His wife contributes income by selling yuca that she takes to the city of Cochabamba.

A few years ago he bought a plot of land in the same community that's already under construction, but he hasn't managed to finish because of the costs.

Currently he's requesting a small loan to be able to finish construction and live more peacefully with his family in his own house.

loans.use: to build his home

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: La señora Delia, tiene 51 años de edad, es casada, vive en una zona netamente dedicada a la actividad pecuaria lechera, la señora tiene esta actividad pecuaria hace 25 años y ha crecido poco a poco en su granja.  La señora Delia tiene dos hijos dependientes en edad escolar, su esposo es trabajador de mano de obra, trabaja en obras de construcciones en diferentes zonas del departamento de Cochabamba.  Los dos han podido construir su vivienda poco a poco en forma económica a travéz de los años de trabajo y esfuerzo de mano de obra propia en el tiempo que les resta de las jornadas de trabajo regular.  Necesita capital de inversión para comprar una vaca lechera que le ayudará con su producción actual disminuida porque sus otras vacas están preñadas.  Asimismo está mejorando la infraestructura de su pequeña granja con la ampliación de sus comederos.
texts.en: Delia, 51, is married and lives in a zone completely dedicated to dairy farming.  She’s been a dairy farmer for 25 years and has gradually expanded her farm.  Delia has two dependent, school age children.  Her husband’s a laborer working in construction in various zones in Cochabamba Department.  Both of them have succeeded in gradually building their house economically over the years by means of years of work and their own labor during their free time from their regular jobs.  She needs investment capital to buy a dairy cow that will help her with her diminished production because her other cows are pregnant.  She will also improve the infrastructure of her small farm by enlarging the feeders.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Faheem

texts.en:
Faheem is 30 years old. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan. He owns an animal sales business. He purchases cattle and goats, cows from the field, and sells them at a profitable price in the main market. This is the only source of income for his family. 

Presently he is interested to purchase cattle and goats for his business which will help him to increase his net income and savings. However, due to his lack of funds, he finds it difficult. Therefore he has requested a loan of 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he can purchase animals from the field and sell them in the market at a profitable price. With the profit he wants to grow his business in the future. 

Faheem is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and goats to sell.

loans.name: One

texts.en: One is a 31 year old woman who is married with 3 children. She runs a business selling sugar,flour,salt,mutton,chicken etc in her community. She has 2 years of experience with this business. One has requested a loan to buy bags of salt,sugar,flour,box of mutton flaps,chicken and to pay school fees. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy bags of salt,sugar,flour box of mutton flaps,chicken and school fees

loans.name: Lilipeta

texts.en:
"Lilipeta is 26 years old and married with 2 children. 
She has a small garden where she grows green pepper,white pepper,tomatoes etc that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 4 years. Lilipeta needs a loan to buy seeds of tomatoes,green pepper,white pepper,cucumber,cabbages and ginger. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Lilipeta will use the profits from her sales to extend her house."

loans.use: to buy seeds of tomatoes,green pepper,white pepper,cucumber,cabbages and ginger

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a 20 year old woman who is single with no children. She runs a business selling different variety of goods in her community. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Josephine has requested a loan to buy box of noodles,bags of sugar,flour,rice,soft drinks,cigarette and snacks. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy box of noodles,bags of sugar,flour,rice,soft drinks,cigarette and snacks

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 21 years old and single with no children. She wants to start a small business making and selling Ice Cakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy  plastic bags, milk, vanilla, sugar and deep freezer. In the future, Gloria Fruean hopes to extend her business. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy  plastic bags, milk, vanilla, sugar and deep freezer

loans.name: Oinaivaoese

texts.en: Oinaivaoese is 19 years old and single with no children. She wants to start a small business making and selling Pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to to buy sacks of sugar, flour, dripping and baking powder. In the future, Oinaivaoese hopes to extend her business and help her family. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar, flour, dripping oil and baking poweder

loans.name: Faauliuli

texts.en: Faauliuli is 21 years old and single with no children. She wants to start a small business making and selling Porkbuns in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy flour,box of chicken, soya sauce, garlic,yeast,garosine,plastic containers and gas. In the future, Faauliuli hopes to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, box of chicken, garlic,soy sauce ,yeast, garosine,plastic containers and gas

loans.name: Simeamativa

texts.en: Simeamativa is 38 years old and married with 8 children. She is running a shop business selling general products such as food, stationaries and ect. She has requested a loan to buy a deep freezer,boxes of tin fish,corn beef,sack of sugar,bag of rice and bag of flour. Simeamativa  will use her profits to improve/extend her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2007.

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer, boxes of tin fish, corn beef,sack of sugar,bag of rice and bag of flour.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina is 30 years old and married with 3 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling Ice cake in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy foam cups, chiness lollies, sack of sugar and cordial. In the future, Sina hopes to extend her bussiness. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy foam cups, chiness lollies, sack of sugar and cordial

loans.name: Sera

texts.en: Sera is a 23year old woman who is married with no children. She plans to start a small business, taxi.  Sera needs a loan to buy wheel caps, seat covers, tyres and vehicle paint. She will use her profits so that she can have her own taxi stand. Sera joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy wheel caps, seat covers, tyres and vehicle paint

loans.name: Etevise

texts.en: Etevise is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy sack of sugar,flour, dripping oil,iron roofing and cement. In the future, Etevise hopes to improve/extend her business. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy sack of sugar, flour, dripping  oil , iron roofing and cement

loans.name: Taena

texts.en: Taena is 39 years old and married with 4 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling Porkpun in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy sacks of flour, sugar, soya sauce, garlic,  and dripping oil. In the future, Taena hopes to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy sack of flour, boxes of chicken, garlic, soy sauce and dripping oil

loans.name: Selafina

texts.en: Selafina is 55 years old and married with 3 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling Elei materials in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy materials,elei designs, rollers and brushes . In the future, Selafina hopes to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, elei designs, rollers and brushes

loans.name: Noela

texts.en: Noela is 36 years old and married with 5 children. She runs a small business selling biscuit in her community and has been doing this for more than 4 years. Noela has requested a loan to buy a bag of flour, bag of sugar,  pan, baking powder and dripping oil. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Noela will save it for her childrens education and for unexpected emergency.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, bag of sugar,  pan, baking powder and dripping oil

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en: Akenese  is a 36 years old  married with 3 children. She has a small garden where she grows taro,banana,yam and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years.Akenese needs a loan to buy wheel barrow, shovel, spades, fertilizer, gloves,. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010.Akenese will use the profits from her sales to save for her childrens school fees

loans.use: to buy  wheel barrow, shovel, spades, fertilizer, gloves,.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is a 29 year old married woman with 4 children. She would like to start growing taro,taamu,banana,and yam to earn a living.Susana has requested a loan to buy mist blower, bush knives, gloves, wheel barrow, fertilizer.Susana will spend her profits to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy mist blower, bush knives, gloves, wheel barrow, fertilizer

loans.name: Siaunnua

texts.en: Siaunuua is a 21 years old single woman with no children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Siaunuua needs a loan to buy sack of sugar,flour,yeast,frying pans and dripping oil. She plans to use her profits to improved her business and support her family. Talaitaua has been a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy  sack of sugar,flour,yeast, frying pans and dripping oil

loans.name: Faalan U

texts.en: Faalanu is 48 years old and married with 5 children. She has a small garden where she grows taro,taamu, banana and cabbages that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years.Faalanu needs a loan to buy shovels, spades, mist blower, fertilizer, wheel barrow. She has been a member of SBPD since 2009.Faalanu will use the profits from her sales to save for her childrens school fees and to support her family

loans.use: to buy shovels, spades, mist blower, fertilizer, wheel barrow.

loans.name: Mavaega

texts.en:
"Mavaega is 34 years old and married with 4 children. 
She has a chips business that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Mavaega needs a loan to buy walker frying pan, pots, sack of potatoes,dripping oil and spoon. 
She has been a member of SBPD in 2013. Mavaega will use the profits from her sales to support her family and her children's education."

loans.use: to buy walker frying pan, pots, sack of potatoes,dripping oil and spoon

loans.name: Teresa Del Jesús

texts.es:
En el sitio Rio Bravo de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquilla conocidos dentro y fuera del país, se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Banco Comunal Bankito Rio Bravo.

En este lugar vive la señora Teresa, tiene 66 años de edad, es casada y de esta relación tienen 10 hijos mayores de edad, tres de ellos aun viven con ellos. Su esposo es agricultor.

Doña Teresa es una muy buena esposa y madre que para ayudar a su marido y a sus  hijos realiza el crédito para que ellos lo utilicen en su trabajo, ellos tienen una pequeña fábrica de ladrillos,trabajan todos los días y los  ladrillos los entregan a comerciantes que les hacen pedidos con anticipación, les piden para luego llevarlos a vender a otras ciudades donde son utilizados para la construcción de viviendas. Ellos llevan más de 20 años dedicados a esta actividad la cual les permite salir adelante honradamente.

Este crédito es para comprar madera y tierra que utilizan para elaborar los ladrillos. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe del banco. 

Su sueño es tener un camión para ir a vender sus productos y así tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
The members of the Bankito Rio Bravo communal bank meet every 15 days in Rio Bravo de Montecristi.  The city is known for its great diversity of typical products like the straw hats that are known within and outside of the country.

This is where Teresa, age 66, lives.  She is married and has ten adult children.  Three of them still live with them.  Her husband is a farmer.  Teresa is a very good wife and mother.  In order to help her husband and children, she is getting the loan for them to use in their work.  They have a small brick factory.  They work every day, and they deliver the bricks to the merchants who place their orders in advance.  They order them to later take them to other cities to sell.  They are used for home construction.  They have been doing this business activity for over 20 years.  It allows them to get ahead honorably.

This loan is to buy wood and soil that they use to make the bricks.  She is the founder of the communal bank, and she likes it for the benefits that the bank gets.

Her dream is to have a truck to use to sell her products.  This way she will get more profits.

loans.use: to buy wood and soil.

loans.name: Jaime Braulio

texts.es: El Sr. Braulio de condición humilde, de estado civil casado, tiene un solo hijo a quien apoya moral y económicamente, requiere el crédito para refacción de su vehículo, ya que es su principal fuente de ingreso, según afirmo el Sr. Braulio está ahorrando para poder construir su casita que su padre le dio como herencia, pues por ello le urge poder hacer arreglar su movilidad para seguir trabajando y seguir ahorrando para la construcción de su inmueble, por tal motivo su esposa también se dedico a la venta de abarrotes para poder ayudar en la canasta familiar ya que de ahí es de donde utiliza para poder cocinar todos los días, ya que es una ayuda para el Sr. Braulio y al mismo tiempo un apoyo que necesita para seguir adelante y tener a corto plazo lo que tanto sueña, pues de esa manera su hijo y su esposa estarán mas cómodos en un lugar de su propiedad.
texts.en: Braulio is of limited means.  He’s married and has a son who he supports morally and economically.  He needs the loan to repair his vehicle because it’s his main source of income.  According to what Braulio said, he’s saving up to be able to build the house his father passed down to him as an inheritance and to do so it’s urgent that he repair his vehicle so he can continue working and saving for the construction of his house.  Because of this, his wife also went into selling groceries to help with the household economy since that’s where she gets what she needs to cook their daily meals.  That’s a help for Braulio and support for what he needs to continue forward and attain what he so desires in the short run.  In this way, his wife and son will be more comfortable in a place of their own.

loans.use: to service and repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Triwana Sari Group

texts.en: Ni Komang wants to increase her business by keeping local pigs for making 'pig roll'. She needs a new loan to purchase three local pigs and feed for them. Pigs for pig roll are usually only kept for two or three months and then sold. Her husband supports her business by helping her to give feed and clean the cage. Ni Komang saves her profit because she has a dream: to renovate her kitchen.

loans.use: to purchase three local pigs and feed for them

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a rickshaw body for their transport business

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.en: Farrukh is 34 years old. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan. He is a responsible father of one son. He owns a hotel in the area which is the only source of income for his family. He wants to purchase chicken, beef, mutton, pulses (lentils) and vegetables for his business. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult. Therefore Farrukh has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to cover the cost of purchasing needed food products for the hotel. This will help him to continue his business and to increase his net income. Farrukh is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase chicken, beef, mutton, pulses and vegetables for hotel business

loans.name: Neetia

texts.en: Neetia is 50 years old and married with 7 children. She has a small garden where she grows taro,taamu,yam,and banana that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years.Neetia needs a loan to buy chemicals,knives,weedspray, chainsaw,shovels, for her plantation.Neetia will use the profits from her business for her children school fees.

loans.use: to buy chemicals,knives,weedspray , chainsaw, shovels.

loans.name: Falemalu

texts.en: Falemalu is a 37 year old married woman with 4 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro,taamu,banana, to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years.Falemalu has requested a loan to buy fertilizers,chemicals,weed spray,shovels. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. With her profits,  hopes to extend her business into the next level and to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, weed spray, shovels,

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en:
"Epenesa is a 33 year old married woman with 1 child. 
She has a cattle farm to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. Epenesa has requested a loan to buy barred wire, rope and small calves. 
She has been a member of SBPD in 2013. With her profits,Epenesa hopes to buy more calves and also save more money for her child's education.
"

loans.use: to buy barred wire, rope and small calves

loans.name: Natalie

texts.en: Natalie is a 28 year old woman who is married with 2 children. She runs a huge plantation selling varieties of vegetables, banana, taro and taamu in her community. She has been doing this for more than 6 years. Natalie has requested a loan to buy wheel barrow, shovels, fertilizer, gloves,mist blower. She plans to use her profits to save for her children's education and to support her family needs. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy wheel barrow, shovels, fertilizer, gloves,mist blower

loans.name: Liliana Patricia

texts.es:
En el sitio Rio Bravo de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquilla conocidos dentro y fuera del país, se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Banco Comunal Bankito Rio Bravo.

En este lugar vive la señora Liliana, tiene 24 años de edad, es casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 8 y 3 años, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es artesano.

Doña Liliana es una muy buena madre y esposa que con la finalidad de ayudarle a su marido realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en su trabajo, él se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos (material utilizado en la construcción de viviendas) este crédito es para la elaboración de ladrillos los mismos que entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta el lugar aunque a veces el también contrata un camión y lleva sus productos hasta otros lugares. Así ellos se ganan la vida honradamente y sacan adelante su hogar.

Este crédito es para comprar leña, tierra y aserrín. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los  créditos son rápidos y sin tantos requisitos. 

Sus sueños son tener salud y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the Bankito Rio Bravo communal bank meet every 15 days in Rio Bravo de Montecristi.  The city is known for its great diversity of typical products like the straw hats that are known within and outside of the country.

This is where Liliana, age 24, lives.  She is married and has two children, ages eight and three.  The oldest goes to school.  Her husband is a craftsman.  Liliana is a good mother and wife.  In order to help her husband, she is getting the loan for him to use in his work.  He makes bricks (material used for building houses).  This loan is for making bricks, which he delivers to merchants who come to their area.  Sometimes he hires a truck and takes the products to other places.  This is the way they earn a living honorably and get their household ahead.

This loan is to buy firewood, soil, and sawdust.  She has been in the communal bank since the beginning.  She likes it because the loans are quick and without so many requirements.
