Ketino is 39 years old. She lives in the capital city of Georgia, Tbilisi with her 27 year old sister and 16 year old daughter. Ketino requested loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 
Ketino has a grocery shop and earns daily income. Also her sister is a dentist, working at the local dentist clinic and earns small monthly salary.
Ketino requested loan from Credo to start-up family business. Ketino has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit Ketino will purchase grocery stocks for her grocery shop. Her shop is already well known at the neighborhood and Ketino wants to expand the stock, in order to offer better choice of products to her clients. This will increase the sales number and Ketino will be able to earn better profit. Part of the profit she will reinvest in the same business and purchase more verities of products. Another part will be used to improve the family living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase grocery stocks for her grocery shop

loans.name: Akaki

texts.en:
29 years old Akaki lives in Zestaponi district with his 22 year old wife, parents and retired grandparents. Akaki requested loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 
The main source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. They have two milk cows, a vineyard and plot of land, where different vegetables are grown. Harvested products with the dairy products are sold at the local markets and among the villagers. Family additional income is Akaki’s grandparent’s monthly pensions which totally is 250 Gel.
Akaki requested loan from Credo to start-up family business. Akaki has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Akaki will purchase a car from abroad at the low cost. He will transport it to Georgia and sell with the price mark up to earn a profit. Part of the profit he will reinvest in the same field to continue working with the car sales. Another part he will add to the family monthly income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a car from abroad for resale

loans.name: Neida Margoth

texts.es:
La Señora Neida se encuentra en el segundo crédito que realiza banco comunal Mujeres con Visión, vive por la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad guarda una rica historia al igual que la belleza de su arquitectura colonial, su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente aun mantienen vivas su cultura y tradiciones.
 
La Señora Neida tiene 31 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 2 hijos, uno de 5 años de edad que estudia en una escuelita de la localidad y su segundo hijo de apenas 11 meses de edad. Su esposo es comerciante, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

Doña Neida se dedica la venta de huevos de codorniz cocidos, esta actividad la realiza desde hace algún tiempo y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.

 Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una nueva carreta para su negocio y huevos de codorniz para la venta.

 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Neida’s in her second loan with the “Mujeres con Visión” (Women with Vision) communal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city with a rich history as well as beautiful colonial architecture.  Its cuisine is a delight for locals and foreigners alike.  Its people still keep their culture and traditions alive.

Neida, 31, lives in a common law relationship and has had two children, a five-year-old attending a little local school and her second son who is just 11-months-old.  Her husband’s a merchant.  They don’t own a house, they are renters.

Neida works selling cooked quail eggs, an activity she’s been doing for some time now; she works Sunday to Sunday with no fixed schedule.  She will use her loan to buy a new cart for her business and quail eggs to sell.  Her dream is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy a cart and quail eggs.

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.es:
La Señora. Bertha se encuentra realizando su cuarto crédito en el banco comunal Mujeres con Visión, le gusta la banca comunal porque en cada reunión  se encuentra con sus amigas y sale de su rutina diaria de trabajo. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad guarda una rica historia al igual que la belleza de su arquitectura colonial, su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente aun mantienen vivas su cultura y tradiciones. 

La Señora. Bertha tiene 33 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos  de 17, 15, 8 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo pasa en casa, su segunda hija aunque es muy joven es casada y vive independiente, su tercer hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo se dedica al comercio, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Bertha se dedica al comercio ambulante de ropa, joyas, cosméticos y más productos, esta actividad la realiza desde hace algunos años, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa, joyas y cosméticos.

Su meta es tener un local propio para vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
Bertha’s in her fourth loan with the “Mujeres con Visión” (Women with Vision) communal bank.  She likes her communal bank because she meets with her girlfriends at every meeting and gets out of her daily work routine.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city with a rich history as well as beautiful colonial architecture.  Its cuisine is a delight for locals and foreigners alike.  Its people still keep their culture and traditions alive.

Bertha’s 33-year-old, married and has had four children who are 17, 15, 8 and 2 years of age.  Her oldest son stays home, her second daughter is married even though she’s very young and lives independently.  Her third son is attending the local little school.  Her husband works in commerce.  She does not own a house; she’s a renter.

Bertha works selling clothes, jewelry, cosmetics and other products from place to place.  She’s been doing this for several years and works Sunday to Sunday with no fixed schedule.  She will use the loan to buy clothes, jewelry and cosmetics.  Her goal is to have a locale of her own in which to sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy clothes, jewelry and cosmetics.

loans.name: Marlene Maclovia

texts.es:
La Señora. Marlene vive por el sector de Miraflores en la ciudad de Cuenca que es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad desde Diciembre de 1999. Forma parte del banco comunal Loma de la Cruz desde hace 10 años, en todo este tiempo ha llegado a formar parte de un hermoso grupo de mujeres todas ellas guerreras que desean mejorar la estabilidad de sus hogares.

Doña Marlene tiene 54 años, es madre soltera de 6 hijos mayores de edad, tres de ellos son casados viven independientes, sus tres hijos solteros trabajan y le ayudan económicamente. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora Marlene es comerciante, se dedica  a la venta de cosméticos, esta actividad la realiza puerta a puerta vendiendo a sus amigas y conocidas, también tiene una tienda de víveres en la cual trabaja a diario sin horario.

Su crédito va ha invertir en la compra de cosméticos y víveres para su tienda.

Su meta es de comprarse un vehículo para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Marlene lives in the area of Miraflores in the city of Cuenca, which has been a World Heritage Site since December of 1999. She has been part of the Loma de la Cruz communal bank for ten years. In this time, she has become part of a beautiful group of women, all of whom are warriors who wish to improve the stability of their homes.

Marlene, 54, is a single mother of six adult children, three of whom are married and live independently. Her three single children work and help her financially. She does not have her own house, so she rents. 

Marlene is a merchant who sells cosmetics door-to-door to her friends and acquaintances. She also has a grocery store, in which she works daily without a fixed schedule.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of cosmetics and groceries for her store. Her goal is to buy herself a vehicle to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and groceries.

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru: Заррина замужняя женщина и мать пятерых детей. Она проживает в городе Куляб. Ее муж в данное время находится на заработках за пределами страны. Сама Заррина тоже трудится и обеспечивает семью. Вот уже 6 лет как она занимается торговлей. На рынке города у нее имеется торговая точка, где она продает детскую одежду. В бизнесе ей помогает ее старший сын. Заррина закупает свой товар в месяц 4-раза с оптового рынка города Душанбе, привозит в Куляб и продает на рынке по розиночной цене. Заррина очень любит свой торговый бизнес, так как получает хороший доход. Чтобы увеличить товарооборот Заррина обратилась за кредитом. Она просит кредит для закупа сезонной детской одежды.
texts.en: Zarrina is a married woman and a mother of five children.  She lives in the city of Kulob.  Her husband is currently working abroad.  Zarrina also works and provides for the family.  She has been involved in sales for six years.  She has a retail outlet at the city market, where she sells children's clothing.  Her oldest son helps her with the business.  Zarrina buys her goods from a wholesale market in Dushanbe four times per month, brings them to Kulob and sells at a retail price.  Zarrina loves her retail business very much because she earns a good income.  Zarrina requested this loan to increase goods turnover.  She is requesting this loan to purchase seasonal children's clothing.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal children's clothing

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is a 32-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and two daughters. Since 2000, her husband has been running a small vegetable shop and usually sells his vegetables in the central bazaar. Nadia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for the expansion of her husband's shop. With the loan investment, her husband can buy a variety of fresh vegetables that will allow him to offer more varieties to his clients and increase his sales and income. Her husband is a very hard working and honest man and is confident about his family’s bright future.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Mo'tasem appears in her Kiva profile photo.
Yasmeen is a 24-year-old married young woman and a mother to two sons and one daughter. She is a housewife and her husband is a worker who gets low salary, which is barely enough to cover the family's needs and costs.
Yasmeen lives with her family at the edge of a small village near Ramallah called Qebyah, which is near the wall. Yasmeen faces with her family many difficulties because of their near of the wall. This wall deprives them to build over their homes,so they are enforced to build beside.
Yasmeen has took a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing cement, paints and tiles to complete finish the new room they have added near their small house.
This will ensure to Yasmeen and her family better living conditions.

loans.use: To complete building the house

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Wael appears in her Kiva profile photo.
Alaa is a 24-year-old married young woman and a mother to one son. She is a housewife and her husband is a construction worker who earns small income that is barely enough to cover the costs.
Alaa has took a 3,000 USD Youth loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of painting her new house and installing tiles.
Taking this loan will offer to Alaa and her family suitable home condition so they can enjoy living in their new house.

loans.use: To paint the house and install tiles

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 34 years old man from Mumias in Bungoma county which is located in western part of Kenya, he is married to Mwenesi who is a business-lady, he supports four people in the family and has three children who are; 13, 11 and three years old respectively.

He practices dairy farming,and he has been doing this for the last five years and makes a monthly income of KES. 15,000, he has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase one more dairy cow, he will use the anticipated profit to expand the business.

His dream is to become large scale dairy farmer and support his family.

loans.use: To purchase one dairy cow

loans.name: Sellina

texts.en:
Selina is 57 years old mother from Vihiga region which is located in the western part of Kenya married to Elliam who is a businessman and has seven children who are 35, 30, 26, 22, 18, 14 and eight years old respectively.

She has a food kiosk which has been in operating for the last five years and makes a monthly income of KES. 10,000, she is taking her third loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more tables and plastics seats, she will use the anticipated profit to expand her business.

Her dream is to expand her business and support the family.

loans.use: to purchase more tables and plastics seats

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 38 years old married to Fredrick who contributes to the family income. She has been selling cereals for a period of about three years with an income of KES. 25,000.

This is her third loan from KADET LTD and wants to use it to buy more stock of assorted cereals for sale. She hopes to educate her children to the highest level and buy dairy cattle in order to supply milk in the area.

loans.use: to buy more stock of  cereals for sale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 42 years old a business lady. She is a married mother of four school going children. Jane has been selling second hand clothes for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 9,000 which she uses to support her family. 

Jane is applying for her second loan term  from KADET LTD after repaying her previous loan successfully. Jane  will use the loan to purchase shirts, skirts, trousers and sweaters.  With the anticipated profit from the business, she will start investing for her children’s school fees and plough the remaining amount back into the business. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have a good stable business in order to keep improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, skirts, trousers and sweaters

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 59 years old mother from Kakamega region which is located in the western part of Kenya, she is married to Jackson who is a farmer and was blessed with three children who are; 23, 20 and 16 years old respectively.

She has a tailoring stall which has been operating for the last nine years and generates a monthly income of Kes. 7,500, she is taking her third loan from  KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase plain fabric materials, she will use the anticipated profit to expand the current business.

Her dream is to expand her business and educate their children.

loans.use: To purchase plain fabric materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy threads and knitting needles

loans.name: Kuntora

texts.en:
Kuntora is 47 years old. He is married and a father of four children aged between five and fifteen. He has been farming his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last five years.He learned about KADET from women who are already registered members of KADET LTD. 

This will be his seventh loan after paying back the previous loans successfully. He plans to spend the loan amount to prepare land and buy chemicals and fertilizer for his wheat farm.  Because of the climatic condition and fertile soil, wheat has proved to do very well and also the market is readily available in the area for both retail and wholesale buyers. 

Kuntora hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming. His dream is do large-scale farming and have his own farm machinery.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and prepare the land

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria's business of poultry rearing is doing extremely well. She has also ventured into hotel business after receiving financial support from KADET LTD. She is requesting for her fourth loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. 

She intends to use the loan to purchase a fryer double tank to be used in the hotel. She will use the proceeds from the business to purchase more chicks to rear in her farm. 

Her hopes and dreams are to see her hotel grow into a five star hotel.

loans.use: to purchase a fryer double tank

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a woman of thirty one years, married to Joseph Kiarie and a mother of two children, she is a dressmaker and has been in this business for five years now, she gets monthly income of twelve thousand shillings.

This will be Sarah's second loan term and she plans to use the entire loan to buy new materials for making clothes. In future she wants to be a successful tailor and employ people to work for her.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making clothes

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is 41 years old man from Homabay town which is found in Nyanza province, he is married and supports seven people in his family, he has four children who are, 18, 16, 14 and 12 years old respectively.

He has a retail shop which has been operating for the last five years and generates a monthly income of KES. 10,000, he has applied for his second loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase maize flour and any other shop items in bulk, and he will use the anticipated profit to grow his business.

His dream is to have a big business and support the family.

loans.use: To purchase Maize flour and any other shop items

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 29 years old married and supports six people, he runs an Electronic retail shop and a general merchandise retail shop in Kapsabet town.He has been in these business for the last two years of which he gets a monthly income of KES. 30,000.

He has borrowed a loan of KES. 60,000 from KADET LTD and he intends to purchase stock for his retail shop e.g sugar, salt, wheat flour, maize flour, bar soaps, washing powder among other items.

He anticipates getting profit of which he will use to expand his business as well as save for future use.
His dream is to expand his business to a chain of supermarkets.

loans.use: to purchase phone accessories, power cables, extension cords, electric bulbs, and fuses.

loans.name: Baslisa

texts.en:
Baslisa is a single lady of forty seven years, she is a single mother of five children. She sells grocery in Kangemi and has been in this business for thirteen years, she gets monthly income of forty thousand shillings.

This will be Baslisa's first loan with KADET LTD, she plans to use the entire loan to buy more grocery like onion, tomatoes, fruits, potatoes etc.In future she wants to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, onions, potatoes etc for resale

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a man of twenty five years, married to Hannah, they have no children yet, Wilson runs a money transfer business (M-PESA) in Kangemi and has been in this business for three years now, he gets monthly income of fourteen thousand shillings.

This will be Wilson's first loan with KADET LTD, he plans to put the entire money in his business float for M-PESA. In future he wants to open another shop for M-PESA.

loans.use: To add to business float

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 48 years old man from Homabay county which is located in the western part of Kenya, he is a married to Benter who is a farmer, he supports nine people in his family and was blessed with three children who are, 24, 20 and 16 years old respectively.

He sells grains a business he has been doing for the last six years and makes a monthly income of KES. 10,000, he is taking his fourth loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more grains, he will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

He has a dream of becoming a successful businessman and supports his family.

loans.use: To purchase more Maize, Beans and millet.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a twenty seven year old lady, she is a single mother of two children, she sells used shoes for children and grown ups and also sells new suits for men, she has been in this business for seven years now and gets a monthly income of thirty thousand shillings.

This will be Margaret's first loan with KADET LTD, she plans to use the entire loan to buy shoes for resale. In future she wants to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase official and casual shoes for resale

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 26 years old man from in Vihiga County, he supports two people in the family and is married to Doreen who is a business lady, he has one child who is two years old.

He has Boutique where he sells new clothes and new shoes, he has been operating this business for the last six years and makes a monthly income of KES. 25,000, he is taking his second loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase new clothes at a wholesale price for resale. He will use the anticipated profit to start a new business.

His dream is to open another business and support his family.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes for sale.

loans.name: Boshra

texts.en:
Boshra is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Kamal appears in her Kiva profile photo, having the picture in the kitchen of their house.
Boshra is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother to three sons and three daughters. Her husband is employed at the Ministry of Education who earns small salary, which is barely enough to cover the family's needs.
Boshra wants to improve her house's kitchen condition, so she is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing and installing marble stone shelves to the kitchen.
This will make Boshra's movement in the kitchen more easier and fullfill her needs , which will improve her family's living condition positively.
About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To install marble stone shelves to the kitchen

loans.name: Roshdi

texts.en:
Roshdi is a 21-year-old single young man, he lives with his family a modest simple life in Jabalia refugee camp in Gaza. For the past two years, Roshdi has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income to him, but also needs more support to cover the costs.
Roshdi is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him complete the price of purchasing a taxi for his own. This will enable Roshdi to work extra hours and to take additional internal and external requests,  which will improve his income positively.
Roshdi has the picture in front of his taxi.

loans.use: To complete the price of purchasing the taxi

loans.name: Yehia

texts.en:
Yehia who appears in the photo, is a 26-year-old engaged young man, he is employed and earns small salary that is not much enough to cover all his wedding expenses.
Yehia prepares to get marry soon in this Summer, he has amount of money but not enough to cover all his necessary wedding expenses, so he is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing new bedroom furniture. Taking this loan will offer to Yehia comfortable furniture so he can enjoy living in his house with his coming wife.
About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase new bedroom furniture

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 23-year-old single young man. For the past one year, Mohammad has had a cosmetics store located in a distinguished commercial area of the market where there is a good customers movement and has a lot of loyal clients. His project is considered to be a profitable one and the only source of income to him, but also needs from time to time some support to cover urgent needs and costs.
Mohammad is requesting a USD Youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing additional new cosmetics that his customers often like and buy. This will allow him to expand the scope of his work, improve his business, and increase his income positively.
Mohammad has the photo in his cosmetics store.

loans.use: To buy new collection of cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad who appears in the photo, is a 27-year-old single young man. Mohammad has had a barber shop, which is a profitable project and the only source of income to him, but also not much enough to cover all his needs.
Mohammad has took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing new mobile phone to his personal use. Taking this loan will offer to Mohammad new mobile phone, so he will be in contact with his family and his clients, which will improve his living condition.
About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To buy new mobile phone

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 24-year-old single young man, he lives with his family in a small village which is famous of raising sheep and cows and planting olive trees, Ahmad's father is a merchant cows from a long time.
For the past four years, Ahmad has also been raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover costs.
Ahmad is requesting a 1,200 USD Youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing more sheep and expanding and improving the herd's condition. This will increase sales and improve his income.
Ahmad has the photo inside the herd where he is raising sheep.

loans.use: To purchase more sheep to expand the project

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Majed appears in her Kiva profile photo.
Amani is a 28-year-old married young woman and a mother to one son. Amani is a housewife and her husband Majed is a worker who earns small salary, which is barely enough to cover their needs.
Amani lives with her family in a small old house that needs some necessary repairs such as painting and changing new windows. Amani has took a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of painting the house and installing new windows. Taking this loan will offer to Amani and her family suitable home condition so they can enjoy living in their small house.

loans.use: To repair the house

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is a 25-year-old single young man, his father is employed and gets low salary, which is barely enough to cover the family's needs.
For the past two years, Mustafa has had a grocery store selling different types of groceries.  It has been a profitable project, but not enough to cover the costs.
Mustafa is requesting a 2,000 USD Youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request such as rice, sugar and milk. This will increase sales and increase Mustafa's income.
Mustafa has the photo in the grocery store he has.

loans.use: To purchase needed stock of basic groceries

loans.name: Nabeel

texts.en:
Nabeel is a 50-year-old married man and a father to two sons and one daughter. 
For the past five years, Nabeel has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income to the family, but also needs more support to cover some necessary costs.
Nabeel is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing new engine to the taxi he drives. This will increase the taxi capacity to work extra hours and enable Nabeel to take additional internal and external requests, which will improve the family's income positively.
Nabeel has the photo next to his taxi.

loans.use: To purchase new engine to the taxi

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad who appears in the photo, is a 27-year-old married young man and a father to one son. For the past one year, Ahmad has had a shoe stall, he has been selling different types and sizes of shoes that clients often request and buy. His stall located in a good commercial area in the market where there is a good customers movement. His project is a profitable one and the only source of income to him, but also needs more support to cover some costs.
Ahmad is requesting a 1,500 USD Youth loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing new collection of different types and sizes of men, women and kids shoes to sell.
This will increase sales and improve Ahmad's income positively.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Waad

texts.en:
Waad is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Mohammad appears in her Kiva profile photo.
Waad is a 23-year-old married young woman and a mother to one son and one daughter. She is a housewife and her husband is a worker in a bakery who gets small salary, which is barely enough to cover the family's needs.
Waad lives with her family in a small modest house in Jabalia refugee camp in Gaza, she has took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing curtains and sponge mats in order to improve living conditions in her house. Taking this loan will enable Waad and her to enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: To purchase sponge mats and curtains

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud who appears in the photo, is a 25-year-old engaged young man. He is employed and gets small salary, which is not much enough to cover all his wedding expenses.
Mahmoud has took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing new bedroom furniture.
Taking this loan will offer to Mahmoud comfortable and suitable bedroom furniture, so he will be ready to get marry soon and enjoy living in his house with his coming wife.

loans.use: To purchase new bedroom furniture

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi is a 25-year-old single young man. he lives with his family in Tubas Village and he works in agriculture with the rest of the family members. For the past two years, Shadi has had a greenhouse planting different types of vegetables, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income to him, but also still needs more support to cover some costs.
Shadi is requesting a 3,000 USD Youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing tomato seedlings. It will allow Shadi to produce a better crop and thus increase his sales and improve the family's income.
Shadi is photographed inside the greenhouse while he is collecting tomato crop to sell.

loans.use: To purchase tomato seedlings

loans.name: Moen

texts.en:
Moen who appears in the photo, is a 19-year-old single young man, he lives with his family in Jabalia refugee camp in Gaza. His mother earns small pension, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.
Moen is a university student, specializing in interior Design, who wants to complete his studies, so he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help Moen to do his homework and reports and help him in his studies. This will ensure a better future for Moen and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy new laptop

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad who appears in the picture, is a 20-year-old single young man, he lives with his family in Jabalia refugee camp in Gaza. His mother earns small pension, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.
Mohammad is a university student, specializing in Civil Engineering, who wants to complete his studies, so he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help Mohammad to do his homework and reports and help him in his studies. This will ensure a better future for Mohammad and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase laptop

loans.name: Jova Germania

texts.es:
La Señora Jova está realizando su segundo crédito en el banco comunal Mujeres con Visión, en este corto tiempo ha logrado establecer muy buena relación de amistad con todas las integrantes de este hermoso grupo. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad  guarda una rica historia al igual que la belleza de su arquitectura colonial, su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente aun mantienen vivas su cultura y tradiciones. 

La Señora Jova tiene 50 años, está separada de su marido pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 17, 16 y 9 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad y su última hija está en la escuela. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora Jova es oriunda de Babahoyo y hace 30 años llego a esta ciudad para realizar sus estudios universitarios, desde hace 5 años tiene una tienda de víveres y en ella trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. También se dedica a la venta de cosméticos en sociedad con su hermana. 

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para surtir aun más su tienda. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Jova’s in her second loan with the “Mujeres con Visión” (Women with Vision) communal bank.  In this short period of time she’s managed to establish a good friendship with all the members of this beautiful group.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city with a rich history as well as beautiful colonial architecture.  Its cuisine is a delight for locals and foreigners alike.  Its people still keep their culture and traditions alive.

Jova’s 50-years-old and separated from her husband but while married had three children who are 17, 16 and 9 years of age.  Her two oldest children attend a local high school and her youngest daughter attends the school.  She does not own a house; she rents.

Jova is originally from Babahoyo and came to this city 30 years ago to attend university.  She’s had a grocery store for the last five years and she works in it from Sunday to Sunday with no set schedule.  She also works selling cosmetics in partnership with her sister.

She will use the loan to buy groceries to better stock her store.  Her dream is that her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Libia Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora Libia forma parte del banco comunal Loma de la Cruz. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar que es conocida por ser la cuna de grandes poetas y escritores, es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad desde Diciembre de 1999. El banco comunal le gusta por el compañerismo que encontró en todas sus amigas y conocidas. 

Doña Libia tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y no ha concebido hijos, su esposo es un profesional y ejerce la Abogacía, la casa en la que viven es propia.

La Señora. Libia trabaja a diario en su restaurante, lleva en el negocio desde hace 8 años, como le gusta mucho el arte culinario decidió tener su propio negocio y ahora percibe ingresos a diario, es su propio jefe y trabaja a su ritmo. 

El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de víveres de los cuales obtuvo muy buenas ganancias. Con su nuevo crédito va a comprar víveres y gaseosas para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Libia is part of the Loma de la Cruz communal bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca, which is known as the birthplace of great poets and writers. It has been a World Heritage Site since December of 1999. She likes the communal bank because of the sense of community she has found in her friends and acquaintances.

Libia, 48, is married with no children. Her husband is a legal professional. They live in their own house.

Libia works daily in her restaurant. She has been in this business for eight years. Since she likes the culinary arts, she decided to start her own business and she now makes a daily income. She is her own boss and she works at her own pace.

She used her previous loan to invest in the purchase of food, with which she had very good earnings. With her new loan, she will buy food and soft drinks to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy food and soft drinks.

loans.name: Teodocia

texts.en:
Teodocia is 57 years old and married with three children. Teodocia works very hard to provide for them.

Teodocia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like milk, snack foods, bread, soft-drinks, eggs, cream, etc. in her general store.

Teodocia has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items such as milk, snack foods, bread, soft-drinks, eggs, cream, etc. 

Teodocia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like milk, snack foods, bread, soft-drinks, eggs, cream, etc. in her general store

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 54 years old and married with six children.

Veronica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more grocery items like can goods, milk, egg, spices, etc to sell.

Veronica has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Veronica aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items like can goods, milk, egg, spices, etc to sell

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Erma has been in this business for 5 years. Erma earns more income from general store.

Erma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Anna Katrina

texts.en:
Anna Katrina is 32 years old and married with four children.

Anna Katrina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a selling dry goods in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional dry goods to sell.

Anna Katrina has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the selling dry goods for 10 years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Anna Katrina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional dry goods to sell

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is 42 years old and married with four children, one of whom in school, Minda works very hard to provide for them.

Minda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, chips, noodles, can goods, etc to sell.

Minda has been in this business for four years.

In the future Minda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, chips, noodles, can goods, etc to sell

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic works hard to support her family. Marivic is married and has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

Marivic requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Marivic has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Jerrin

texts.en:
Jerrin works hard to support her family. Jerrin is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Jerrin requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her business.

Jerrin has been in this business for 16 years now.

In the future, Jerrin would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 72 years old and widowed with five children.

She earns a living by having a hog raising business in the Philippines. Yolanda is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies for her business.

Yolanda has been in this business for 30 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 50 years old and married with five children.

Lydia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like soft drinks, can goods, noodles, egg, spices, etc..

Lydia has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 26 years and also earns an income from raising chickens.

Lydia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like soft drinks, can goods, noodles, egg, spices, etc.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Adelina works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Adelina is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business for her food vending business.

Adelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 23 years old married to Susan, they have one child. He practices farming in Ndunyu Njeru and also has a motorcycle business.

He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy a dairy cow. He paid his previous loan on time.With anticipated profit he hopes to buy another cow.

He hopes to buy another motorbike in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To put up a stall for her maize business

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is 36 years old and married with one child.She does house rental business in Nairobi and she has been in this business for the past five years.

This is her second loan term with KADET LTD and she plans to use the amount to buy building materials for constructing more rental houses.These materials include building blocks,bags of cement and iron sheets as well as windows and door frames.She will use the generated income to pay school fees for her child.

In future Khadija hopes to buy a big plot and build both commercial and residential houses.

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 56 year old business lady in Embu.  She is a single mother of one and she sells charcoal, a business she has done for the past six years with a monthly income of KES 8,800. 

She is applying for her first loan after she was introduced to KADET by an existing client.  She will use the loan to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers. She plans to use the proceeds from her business to plough back into the business and use the rest to invest in her child’s future. 

She hopes to buy a piece of land to construct a residential house.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 54 year old a business lady and a widowed mother of three. Virginia has been selling second hand clothes and shoes for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 5,000 which she uses to support her family. She also runs a tailoring business to supplement her income.

Virginia is applying for her second loan term with KADET after repaying her previous loan successfully. She  will use the loan to purchase clothes, shoes, and wrappers for resale and with the anticipated profit from the business, she will start investing for her children’s school fees and plough the remaining amount back into the business. 

Her dreams are to have a good stable business in order to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, shoes, and wrappers for resale

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a 37 year old business man. He is married to Zipporah who is a mixed crop farmer and their marriage is blessed with two children, aged five and two years. He has been running a retail shop as his primary business and farming as his secondary business, with a monthly income of KES 7,400, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET and he will use the loan to buy sugar, tea leaves, bar soaps, cooking fat as additional stock for his retail shop and use the rest for his farming. With the anticipated profit from his businesses he intends to start a wholesale shop. 

His dreams are to buy a big piece of land for large scale faming.

loans.use: to buy sugar, tea leaves, bar soaps, cooking fat as additional stock for his retail shop

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a man of sixty one years, married to Hannah, they have one child who live with them and is in college the rest are adults. He does dairy farming and has been in this business for thirteen years, he gets a monthly income of twenty seven thousand  shillings.

This will be Samwel's sixth loan in KADET LTD, he has paid all other loans successfully, he plans to use the entire loan to buy a dairy cow. In future he wants to educate and feed his family.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 61 old industrious lady, married and a mother of three children aged 14, 7 and 4. She buys and sells cereals in Bomet market. 

She learnt about KADET from one of our loan officers and decided to join. She has acquired her first loan of Kes 20,000 which she intends to purchase more cereals for resale at a gain. She will use the proceeds to put up a stall for the upcoming business.

Her hope is to raise the family living standards.

loans.use: to purchase cereals for resale

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah has a tailoring business in Nairobi town.She has been in this business for the past five years and it has been profitable.She is 26 years old and married with three children.

This will be her second loan term and she plans to use the amount to buy an iron box,iron board,needles,threads,pairs of scissors and measuring tapes.She will use the generated income to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to grow her business,make more income and open another tailoring shop.

loans.use: . to buy an iron box,iron board,needles,threads,pairs of scissors and measuring tapes

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is a 42 year old mixed crop farmer and married to Susan a business lady with whom they are blessed with three children.  He has been practicing mixed crop farming for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 8,000 which he uses to support his family. He also operates as a driver of a public service vehicle to supplement his income.

Dominic is applying for his second loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully.  He is glad and appreciates the financial support he has received from KADET and KIVA. His mixed crop farming is doing well. He will use the loan to purchase farm inputs i.e. fertilizer and seedlings. With the anticipated profits from his farm, he will invest in his children’s education.  

His hopes are to purchase a bigger land for farming.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs i.e. fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a man of fifty seven years, married to Esther, he runs a butcher shop in Kangemi and has been doing so for thirteen years now, he gets monthly income of KES.20,000 which he uses to support the family.

This will be Benson's second loan with KADET LTD, he plans to use the entire loan . In future he wants to feed and also provide for one of his daughters who lives with them.

loans.use: to buy meat for resale

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 36 years old, married to Robert and a mother of two. She runs a chemist in the outskirts of Bomet County. The chemist has been in operation for the past one earning her a monthly income of KES 94,000. 

She learnt about KADET from posters distributed at her area of operation. With her first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET she intends to purchase additional drugs for resale as this will boost her purchasing power.

She intends to use the profits gained to reinvest and grow the business. Her future plans is to become a large scale outlet.

loans.use: to purchase medical drugs for sale

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is forty years old, single and a mother of two lovely children, she runs a beauty salon in Kiambu and has been doing so for two years now and earns a monthly income of twenty thousand shillings.

This will be Faith's second loan with KADET LTD, she plans to get the entire loan to buy beauty products like hair shampoo, hair chemicals, hair oil etc. 


In future she wants to educate her children, and also be a prosperous salonist.

loans.use: To buy beauty products like hair oil,hair braids, shampoo etc

loans.name: Bornes

texts.en:
Bornes is a 53 old window and a mother of six children aged between thirty and twelve. She operates a small food cafe in the outskirts of Bomet County for that last two years making a monthly income of kes 18,000. 

She learnt about KADET from some of her clients who are registered members of KADET Limited. She has acquired her first loan of Kes 20,000 which she plans to replace some of the old furniture in the small hotel. She plans to use the proceeds to plough it back for business expansion.

loans.use: To renovate her food store

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 29 years old, married and hard working lady who operates a tailoring shop. She is a mother of three children aged seven, three and one respectively.

She learnt about KADET from posters distributed in her area of work. She has acquired her first loan of kes 20000 which will facilitate her in the purchase of fabrics for dress making. She will use the proceeds to expand to dealing with cultural outfit in the quest of expanding the business.

She hopes to attain financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics for dress making

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 39-year-old married man and a father to three sons and five daughters all of them are below 18 years old. For the past eight years, Omar has been selling mobile phones to customers, his store located in a good commercial area in the market and has many loyal customers, which makes his project a profitable one and the only source of income to the family, but also needs more support to cover some costs.
Omar has took a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing additional new collection of mobile phones to sell. This will increase demand from his customers to buy new mobiles. This will increase his income and offer to him better living conditions. Omar is photographed in his store.

loans.use: To purchase new collection of mobile phones to sell

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Fahmi appears in her Kiva profile photo, having the picture next to his taxi.
Nadia is a 23-year-old married young woman, she is a housewife and has no children yet, she lives with her husband in a small village called Beit Soriek near Ramallah.
For the past five years, Nadia's husband has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income to the family.
Nadia is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing new taxi. This will enable Nadia's husband to work extra hours and to take additional internal and external requests, which will improve the family's income positively.

loans.use: To complete the price of purchasing the taxi

loans.name: Reham

texts.en:
Reham is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.
Reham is a 25-year-old married young woman and a mother to two sons and one daughter. She is a housewife and her husband is a worker who gets low salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.
Reham is requesting a 1,000 USD Youth loan from FATEN to cover the cost of painting her house and making some repairs such as installing new lights. This will ensure to Reham and her family better living conditions.

loans.use: To paint the house and make some repairs

loans.name: Thaer

texts.en:
Thaer who appears in the photo, is a 24-year-old single young man. He works in agriculture with the rest of his family plants different types of vegetables and olive trees.
Thaer is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing new mobile phone for his own use. Taking this loan will enable Thaer to keep in touch with his family members and also with his friends, which will offer to him better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phone

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 24-year-old single young man. He lives with his family in Al-Far'aa refugee camp. For the past three years, Mahmoud has had a store of mobile phones and its accessories, he has many loyal customers, which makes his project a profitable one and the only source of income to him, but also still needs more support to cover some costs.
Mahmoud has took a 3,000 USD Youth loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing new and modern collection of mobile phones and its accessories to sell. This will increase sales and increase Mahmoud's income.
Mahmoud has the photo in his store.

loans.use: To buy new and modern collection of mobile phones and its accessories to sell

loans.name: Leena

texts.en:
Leena is a 33-year-old married young woman and a mother to two sons and one daughter, her husband is employed at the Ministry of Education who gets small salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.
For the past five years, Leena has had beauty salon, she has a good reputation a mong her customers and at the same time she has many loyal customers, which makes her project a profitable one.
Leena is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of installing air condition to her salon and purchasing new beauty salon kit such as different types of hair and body creams, hair brushes and dryers.
This will allow Leena to expand the scope of her work, improve her business, and increase the family's income.
Leena has the photo in her beauty salon.

loans.use: To purchase air condition and new beauty salon kit

loans.name: Genny Elsa

texts.es:
En el sitio Rio Bravo de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquilla conocidos dentro y fuera del país, se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Bankito Rio Bravo.

En este lugar vive la señora Genny, tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos de 18, 14, 11, 8 y  6 años, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es artesano.

Doña Genny es una muy buena madre y esposa que con la finalidad de ayudar a su marido con la carga familiar realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en su trabajo, él se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos (material utilizado en la construcción de viviendas)  los mismos  que entrega a comerciantes para que los vendan en las construcciones de viviendas. Es así como el se gana el sustento y gracias a Dios nunca les ha faltado nada.

Este crédito es para comprar madera y tierra  para elaborar los ladrillos. Ella es fundadora  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos todos es más fácil para financiar el negocio de su marido.
  
Su sueño es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
In Rio Bravo de Montecristi, a city known for its great variety of traditional items like the straw sombreros that are famous both in and outside of the country, every 15 days the members of the Bankito Rio Bravo communal bank meet. 

Genny, who lives here, is 42 years old, married and has five children from this relationship aged 18, 14, 11, 8 and 6. The two eldest study in high school and the younger ones are at primary school. Her husband is an artesan.

Genny is a very good mother and wife who in order to help her husband with the family burden is taking out the loan for him to use in his work. He manufactures bricks (material used in the construction of houses) delivering them to retailers to sell them for house construction. This is how he earns a living and thanks to God has never wanted for anything.

This loan is to buy wood and earth to make bricks. She is founder at the communal bank and likes it because thanks to the loans everything is easier to finance her husband's business. 
  
His dream is that their children complete their education and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy wood and earth [to make bricks].

loans.name: Antonia Soraya

texts.es:
La Señora Antonia es una socia muy activa que forma parte del banco comunal Mujeres con Visión, este banco comunal le gusta porque en cada reunión se encuentra con sus amigas y puede salir de su rutina diaria de trabajo. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad guarda una rica historia al igual que la belleza de su arquitectura colonial, su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente aun mantienen vivas su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña Antonia tiene 41 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 20, 16, 14, 10 años de edad y su ultimo hijo de 6 meses de nacido, dos de sus hijos trabajan, ayudan en los quehaceres del hogar y estudian, uno estudia en el colegio y otro en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Antonia se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida en un pequeño local que tiene y también vende cosméticos, estas actividades le permiten mejorar la estabilidad económica de su hogar y sacar adelante a toda su familia.

Su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de víveres para su negocio del cual obtuvo muy buenas ganancias. Esta repitiendo el crédito ya que necesita comprar víveres, mesas y sillas para mejorar su local.
texts.en:
Antonia’s a very active member of the “Mujeres con Visión” (Women with Vision) communal bank.  She likes this communal bank because at each meeting she meets with her girlfriends and she can get out of her daily work routine.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city with a rich history as well as beautiful colonial architecture.  Its cuisine is a delight for locals and foreigners alike.  Its people still keep their culture and traditions alive.

Antonia is 41-years-old, married and has had five children who are 20, 16, 14, and 10 years of age; her youngest is 6-months-old.  Two of her children work, help with household chores and study; one in high school and the other one in the local little school.  Her husband works as a private employee.  She does not own a house; she rents.

Antonia works making and selling food in a small locale she has; she also sells cosmetics.  These activities make it possible for her to improve her household’s economic stability and move her entire family forward.

She used her previous loan to buy foodstuffs for her business and earned good profits from them.  She’s repeating the loan because she needs to buy foodstuffs, tables and chairs to improve her locale.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Ruth Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora. Ruth esta realizando su primer crédito en el banco comunal Futuro para un Bienestar, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad esta guarda su historia y mantienen intacta su arquitectura colonial, la gastronomía de esta ciudad es variada y cautiva el paladar de sus visitantes, su gente es amable, gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Ruth tiene 49 años, es casada y no tiene hijos, su esposo se dedica al comercio, la casa en la que vive es propia.

La Señora Ruth se dedica desde hace 20 años a la venta de muebles y ropa para lo cual tiene un local, trabaja de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo.

Su crédito es para comprar ropa para surtir más su local. 

Su sueño es viajar a los Estados Unidos.
texts.en:
Ruth is taking out her first loan with the “Futuro para un Bienestar” (A Future for Well-Being).  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city that safeguards its history and keeps its colonial architecture intact.  The city’s cuisine is varied and delights the palates of its visitors.  Its people are kind, courteous and keep their culture and traditions alive.

Ruth is 49-years-old, married and has no children.  Her husband works in commerce.  The house she lives in is hers.

For the last 20 years Ruth has been working selling furniture and clothes for which she has a locale.  She works Monday through Saturday with no fixed schedule.  Her loan is to buy clothes to better stock her store.  Her dream is to travel to the United States.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Maritess

texts.en:
Maritess is 30 years old and married with 3 children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Maritess is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Maritess has been farming rice for 5 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
As a widow parent of one child, Victoria works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Victoria is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of rice to sell for her business

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is forty nine year old hardworking man with eight children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.He has been running a diary farm since 1985 a long side crop production to boost his family income.He has a vision of having a big farm and educating his children to higher levels of learning although like any another farmer,he is faced with hardships of unpredictable weather change.John intends to use the loan to buy six rolls of barbed wire, poles and pay workers.

loans.use: to buy six rolls of barbed wire, poles and pay workers.

loans.name: Kansiime

texts.en: Sauda is a thirty year old hard working woman with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.She is a farmer and does brick making as a side business to boost her income.Her vision is educating her children to higher levels while her business plan is to expand to new areas despite challenge of unpredictable weather change that hider her production.Sauda will use the loan to buy materials for brick making and pay laborers.

loans.use: to buy materials for brick making and pay laborers.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 34 years old and married with one child.

Analiza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, bread, eggs, noodles, canned goods, etc. in her general store.

Analiza has been in this business for 4 years and earns additional income from raising livestock.


Analiza aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional  items to sell like shampoo, bread, eggs, noodles, canned goods, etc. in her general store

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 34 years old and has one child. Editha is married and has one child who is in school.

Editha is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Editha requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Editha has been raising livestock for 3 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Editha would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 50 years old and married with four children.

Editha works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, noodles, etc. to sell in her general store.

Editha has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and raising livestock.

Editha aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, noodles, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a twenty six year old married man living in Fort portal, Uganda.He practices farming and also has a motorcycle transport business.He is faced with a challenge of limited funds to run his businesses although he has a business desire to own at least three motorcycles since the business is very lucrative.John will use the loan to buy another motorcycle which he intends to hire to another rider who will remit 80% of daily earnings.

loans.use: to buy another motorcyle

loans.name: Ma. Nida

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Ma. Nida works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Ma. Nida is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Ma. Nida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Marevilla

texts.en:
Marevilla is 36 years old and has three children. Marevilla is married and has three children who are in school.

Marevilla is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Marevilla requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Marevilla has been in pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marevilla would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 66 years old and married with four children. Ligaya works very hard to provide for them.

Ligaya runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks like snack foods, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, eggs and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Ligaya has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, eggs and other groceries. 

Ligaya would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks like snack foods, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, eggs and other groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a sixty eight year old man with eight children living in Fort portal, Uganda.He practices agriculture  but also runs a restaurant to boost his income and with the proceeds, he has been able to pay fees for his children and buy more land to increase his farming.Lack of enough capital and un predictable weather are his major challenges yet his dream is to build a permanent house for residence. Charles intends to use the loan to buy more utensils for the restaurant.

loans.use: to buy more utensils for the hotel.

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Romana works hard to support her family. Romana is married and has a hog raising business in the Philippines.

Romana requested a PHP 12000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

Romana has been in this business for 8 years now.

Romana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 62 years old, married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Teresita has a bakery business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 60,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar, salt and other ingredients for her bread production business.

Teresita has been in this business for 16 years. Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar, salt and other ingredients for her bread production business

loans.name: Roger

texts.en: Roger is twenty seven year old married man with one child living in Fort portal, Uganda.For the past four years he has been farming but he also works as a hired motorcycle rider who has to remit 80% of the daily earnings to his boss. He is faced with a challenge of lack of enough capital yet from his little savings, he has educated his child.His dream is to buy his own motorcycle.Roger is requesting for a loan to buy a motorcycle for transport business.

loans.use: to buy  motorcycle for transport business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia works hard to support her family. Virgilia is married and has a raising livestock business in the Philippines.

Virgilia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy vaccines and vitamins for her livestock.

Virgilia has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, Virgilia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vaccines and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a fifty eight year old married man with eight children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is farming and also runs a retail shop to boost his income. However, unpredictable weather changes affect his business yet his vision is becoming a model farmer and also educating his children to higher levels of learning. William intends to use the loan to rehabilitate his banana plantation by buying fertilizers and mulching.

loans.use: to rehabilitate his banana plantation by buying fertilizers and mulching

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en:
Vivencia is 69 years old, married with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Vivencia has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines. Vivencia requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more banana to sell.

Vivencia has been in this business for 9 years. Vivencia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more banana to sell

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a twenty eight year old married man with 2 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is brick making alongside motorcycle ridding for transport business to boost his income. His dream is to build a permanent home and educate his children further despite the hardships of unpredictable weather changes and limited capital. Moses needs a loan to buy fire wood and pay labour.

loans.use: to buy fire wood and pay labour.

loans.name: Doviko

texts.en: Doviko is a sixty four year old man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.For thirty years he has been  farming along side running a retail business and he has been able to educate his children and build a house although he is faced with a challenge of price fluctuation.He has a dream of having a stable family income.Doviko will use the loan to improve on his gardens by buying fertilizers.

loans.use: to mprove on the garden by buying fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more second hand clothes to sell..

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Adelyn

texts.en:
Adelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Adelyn requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like snack foods, sardines, detergent and other groceries.

She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Adelyn would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, sardines, detergent and other groceries.

loans.name: Ma. Macvil

texts.en:
Ma. Macvil is 45 years old, married with five children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Macvil has a shells crafting business in the Philippines. Ma. Macvil requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her shells crafting.

Ma. Macvil has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Ma. Macvil would like to build and expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her shells crafting.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a fish farm in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Lilian is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds for her fish and pigs.

Lilian has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds for her fish and pigs

loans.name: Geronima

texts.en:
Geronima is 42 years old, married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Geronima has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Geronima requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Geronima has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Geronima would like to build and expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Florites

texts.en:
Forites is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase more items like shampoo, snack foods and other groceries.

Florites successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

NWTF is re-listing Forites's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like shampoo, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
