Stanley is a 52 years old a mixed crop farmer and married to Ruth a business lady with whom they are blessed with two children.  He has been practicing mixed crop farming for the past eleven years with a monthly income of KES 9,000 which he uses to support his family. 

Stanley is applying for his third loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully.  He is glad and appreciates the financial support he has received from KADET and KIVA. His mixed crop farming is doing well. He will use the loan to purchase farm inputs i.e. fertilizer and seedlings. With the anticipated profits from his farm, he will invest in his children’s education.  

His dreams are to purchase a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs i.e fertilizer and seedling

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 40 years old and married with five children.He has a furniture making business in Makueni town where he make metal doors and window frames for buildings.He also make metal chairs and tables for various schools and hotels in the area.He has been in this business for 10 years now and it has been profitable.

This will be his fourth loan term with KADET LTD and he plans to use the amount to buy more stock of materials e.g metal bars for making chairs,doors and window frames.He also plans to buy protective and safety equipments such as gloves and aprons for his workers.

In future,Joseph hopes to expand his business by opening another furniture shop in the area,make more income and be able to provide for the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of materials e.g metal bars for making chairs,doors and window frames   and gloves $  aprons

loans.name: Nkosho

texts.en:
Nkosho is 43 years old, married to Naipanoi M., and the father of six children. For the last 13 years, he has farmed his own piece of land and earns a good income. Wheat farming is his specialty and has proved to be doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. 

He learned about KADET LTD through advertising posters which had been plastered in his area. This will be his fourth loan of Kes 60,000 which he plans to use to buy farm inputs and hire machinery for preparation of the land.  With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat.
His future dreams are that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land, plant more wheat for commercial farming, buy his own farm machinery, and educate his children. He is a hardworking man who is focused on his set goals.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a young gentleman aged 24 years old and operates a  motorcycle transport business.He has been in the business for the last two years earning a monthly income of KES. 9,000

He learnt about KADET LTD from other motorcycle riders who are registered with KADET LTD. He has acquired his first loan of KES. 77,000 which will enable him buy his own motorcycle. 


He hopes to use the proceeds to mean his basic needs. His dream is to own a car.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is 44 years old married, and has three children who are in school. 

She is in a transport business in Naivasha which she has been operating for the past four years. She has applied for her third loan from KADET LTD to enable her pay school fees. She paid her previous loan successfully.

She hopes to buy another matatu in the near future.

loans.use: To pay school  fees for her children.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is applying for a second loan term from KADET LTD after repaying her first loan successfully. Her retail business is doing extremely well especially after she obtained loan from KADET LTD. She managed to restock her shop thus expanding her customer base. 

She is requesting for a second business loan to purchase more washing detergents, cooking oil, baking powders and sugar. She will use the anticipated profits to support her husband in his farming business.

loans.use: to purchase more washing detergents, cooking oil, baking powders and sugar

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary practices farming in Nakuru and has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy seeds and fertilizer. She paid her previous loan successfully. With anticipated profit,she plans to pay school fees for her children.  

In the near future she hopes to increase her farm output.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Miriam Gricelda

texts.es:
La Señora. Miriam forma parte del banco comunal Futuro para un Bienestar desde hace 3 años, tiempo en el cual ha establecido grandes lasos de amistad con todas sus amigas y compañeras del grupo. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad guarda su historia y mantienen intacta su arquitectura colonial, la gastronomía de esta ciudad es variada y cautiva el paladar de sus visitantes, su gente es amable, gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Miriam tiene 31 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 10 y 8 años que están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. La casa en la que viven es de su madre con quien comparte los gastos del hogar.

Doña Miriam trabaja en un taller de tapicería de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, en este trabajo se encuentra desde hace algunos años.

Este crédito es para comprar una máquina de escribir para realizar su trabajo desde su casa. 

Su meta es tener un vehículo propio.
texts.en:
Miriam has been a member of the “Futuro para un Bienestar” (A Future for Well-Being) communal bank for three years in which time she’s established strong bonds of friendship with all her girlfriends and fellow group members.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city that safeguards its history and keeps its colonial architecture intact.  The city’s cuisine is varied and delights the palates of its visitors.  Its people are kind, courteous and keep their culture and traditions alive.

Miriam is 31-years-old and the single mother of two children who are 10 and 8 years of age and attending the little local school in the city.  The house they live in his her mother’s and she shares household expenses with her.

Miriam works in an upholstery shop from Monday to Saturday from 8 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon; she’s had this job for some years.

This loan is to buy a typewriter so she can work from home.  Her goal is to own a car.

loans.use: to buy a typewriter.

loans.name: Gladys Eufemia

texts.es:
La Señora. Gladys esta en el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal Futuro para un Bienestar, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad guarda su historia y mantienen intacta su arquitectura colonial, la gastronomía de esta ciudad es variada y cautiva el paladar de sus visitantes, su gente es amable, gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Gladys tiene 55 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos  mayores de edad, dos de ellos están casados pero solo uno vive  independiente, su otro hijo casado  vive en su casa compartiendo los gastos del hogar, su hija soltera también trabaja y ayuda a la economía de la casa. Su esposo labora como instructor de manejo, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora. Gladys se dedica al comercio de ropa de todo tipo y para todo género, también vende cosméticos de diferentes marcas, su producto lo ofrece desde su casa a sus amigas y conocidas y hay días que también lo vende recorriendo la ciudad.

Su crédito va a ser invertido en la compra de ropa de moda para su clientela.

Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
Gladys is in the third loan she’s had with the “Futuro para un Bienestar” (A Future for Well-Being) communal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city that safeguards its history and keeps its colonial architecture intact.  The city’s cuisine is varied and delights the palates of its visitors.  Its people are kind, courteous and keep their culture and traditions alive.

Gladys is 55-years-old, married and has had three children who are all adults now.  Two of them are married but only one of them lives independently.  Her other married son lives at home and shares household expenses.  Her single daughter also works and helps out with the home’s economy.  Her husband works as a driving instructor.  She does not own a house; she rents.

Gladys works selling all types of clothes for both genders and also sells cosmetics of various brands.  She sells her goods from home to friends and acquaintances; sometimes there are days when she sells from place to place in the city.
She will use her loan to buy in-style clothes for her clientele.  Her dream is to own a boutique.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Karina Verónica

texts.es:
La Señora Karina desde hace algún tiempo forma parte del banco comunal Loma de la Cruz, de este grupo de amigas le gusta la unión y compañerismo, en cada reunión sale de su rutina diaria de trabajo, se divierte y conversa de varios temas de su interés. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar que es conocida por ser la cuna de grandes poetas y escritores, es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad desde Diciembre de 1999.

La Señora. Karina tiene 22 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido un hijo de 2 años de edad. Su esposo es comerciante, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Ella se dedica a la venta ambulante de ropa en su tiempo libre ya que también está trabajando como empleada privada, estos dos oficios le dan la oportunidad de mejorar la estabilidad económica de su hogar y sacar adelante a su familia. 

Su crédito anterior lo invirtio en la compra de ropa de la cual obtuvo buenas ganancias, su nuevo crédito también lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para tener más variedad para su clientela.
texts.en:
Karina has been a member of the Loma de la Cruz communal bank for some time. She likes the unity and sense of community of this group of friends. In every meeting, she is able to get out of her daily work routine, have fun, and talk about a variety of topics of interest. She lives in the city of Cuenca, which is known as the birthplace of great poets and writers. It has been a World Heritage Site since December of 1999.

Karina, 22, lives with her partner and has a two-year-old son. Her spouse is a merchant. They do not have their own home, so they are renting.

She works as a traveling clothing saleswoman in her free time, since she also works as a private employee. These two jobs give her the opportunity to improve the financial stability of her home and provide for her family.

She invested her previous loan in the purchase of clothing, with which she earned a good income. She will also use this loan to buy clothing so that she can have a greater variety for her clientele.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Dalila Eufemia

texts.es:
La Señora Dalia es socia del banco comunal Loma de la Cruz desde hace algunos años, ella es una persona de muy buen humor y muy alegre que contagia a todas sus compañeras del grupo, el banco comunal le gusta por la unión y compañerismo del grupo, también porque los créditos le ayudan a crecer en el negocio.

La Señora Dalila tiene 59 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos, 3 de ellos son casados y viven independientes, su hijo soltero trabaja y le ayuda económicamente. Su esposo es jubilado y ahora labora como comerciante, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Dalia desde hace algunos años se dedica a la venta de ropa, su mercadería la vende recorriendo la ciudad y tambien viaja a otras ciudades donde tiene clientela que le realizan pedidos. Esta actividad le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos y mejorar la economía de su hogar. 

Su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de ropa de la cual obtuvo buenas ganancias,  su nuevo crédito también lo va a invertir en ropa para cubrir sus pedidos que tiene que entregar a su clientela.
texts.en:
Dalila has been a member of the Loma de la Cruz community bank for a number of years.  She is a person whose good temper and cheerfulness prove infectious among her fellow group members.  She likes her community bank because of the unity and friendship that exists among its members.  She also likes the loans as they help her to grow her business.

Dalila is 59 years old, married, and has four children: three of her children are married and live independently.  Her son who is still single works and helps out financially.  Her husband is retired and now works as a trader.  She does not own her own home but rents instead.

Dalila has been selling clothing for a number of years.  She sells her merchandise throughout the city and also travels to other cities where she has customers who place orders with her.  This business has allowed her to provide for her children and improve the financial situation of her household.

Dalila invested her previous loan in buying clothing which made her good profits.  She will invest this loan in buying clothing as well so that she can fill some orders that she has to deliver to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a forty six year hard working man with five children living in Fort portal, Uganda. He farms on a large scale in order to sustain his family although like any other person in the sector, he faces challenges of un predictable weather changes.Despite the challenges ,he has been able to educate his children and has a dream of educating them all to university level.Moses will use the loan to buy seeds for planting.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric is a 33 year old married man with 3 children living in Kamwenge,Uganda.He operates a drug shop and he decided to start the business in order to raise income to provide for his family daily needs.High license fees and inadequate capital affect his business while his dream is to own a pharmacy since the demand for drugs is high from his community.Eric intends to use the loan to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a 34 year old hardworking -honest married woman blessed with 3 children living in Fort portal-Uganda.She is a primary teacher by profession and also has a retail shop in order to meet her family daily expenses since her meager salary can hardly meet her needs. She has been in service for twelve years now and she was inspired by her desire to nature young people. Irene intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a 31 year old hardworking man with 3 children living in Fort Portal,Uganda.His main business is transport along side small scale farming to boost his income.He faces hardships of unpredictable weather changes and poor roads however his desire s to complete building his house and educating his children to higher levels of learning. Christopher is requesting for a loan to buy sand and cement for construction of his residential house.

loans.use: To buy sand and cement for construction of his residential house.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Steven is a 29 year old hard working-honest married man with 3 children living in Fort portal –Uganda.He is a very ambitious man who is involved in a number of businesses which include motorcycle transport ,selling bananas and he also does subsistence farming.Price fluctuation and lack of adequate capital affect the business while his dreams are to venture into commercialized agriculture.Steven intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Paulo

texts.en: Paulo used the previous loan to construct cottages, but due to high demand he needs more capital to construct more cottages. In his business, he faces challenges of seasonal weather and price fluctuations. His dream is building a permanent home,constructing shades for his customers and expanding the business into new markets. Paulo intends to use this loan to boost business by constructing grass thatched shades for his customers.

loans.use: to construct grass thatched shades for his customers.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en: Justus is a 40 year old married man with 4 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is livestock production, the business he started with a vision of supporting and increasing his income. He also practices farming to boost his income.He has hardships of poor roads which hinder him so much however, he has a vision of buying land to establish a ranch.Justus is requesting for a loan to buy goats and chicken for rearing.

loans.use: to buy chicken and goats for rearing.

loans.name: Zam

texts.en: Zam is a 42 year old hard working single mother living in Fort portal, Uganda. She operates a retail shop as well as selling fire wood and charcoal. She began the business 12 years back with the aim of educating the children and supporting her family and has since reaped tangible benefits.Price fluctuation is her major hardship while her dream is to trade in whole sale and construct a good permanent residential house.Zam intends to use the loan to buy cassava flour & general merchandise such as salt and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour & general merchardise such as salt and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 58 years old, married with 6 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Felicidad has a general store business in the Philippines. Felicidad requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like shampoo, diapers, snack foods and other groceries.

Felicidad has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Felicidad would like to build and expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like shampoo, diapers, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy more feeds for her fish.

Alicia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Alicia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish and feeds.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 32 years old and married with four children. Cheryl works very hard to provide for them.

Cheryl runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

Cheryl has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, detergent, diapers and other snack foods. 

Cheryl would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Clementina

Clementina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Clementina has been in this business for seven years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.name: Erlinda

Erlinda has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other sea-foods to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Evelyn

Evelyn requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional trisikad.

She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional trisikad.

loans.name: Evelyn

Evelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Evelyn has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

NWTF is re-listing Josephine's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.name: Julieta

Julieta has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, cooking oil, egg and other seasosings. 

In the future Julieta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rope making business in the Philippines.

Julita requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her rope making.

She has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Julita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her rope making.

loans.name: Margarita

Margarita is 36 years old, married and has three children who are all in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Margarita has a shells-crafting business in the Philippines. Margarita requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her shells crafting business.

Margarita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Margarita would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her shells crafting business.

NWTF is re-listing Mary Jane's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
Paterna is married and she works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Paterna has been in this business for three years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Paterna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.en: This time, for her 18th cycle loan, Pelagia is borrowing Php 20000 to fund her fish vending business, which was previously funded through Kiva's partner, NWTF.  The business continues to provide Pelagia's family with income that is improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 56 years old, married and has 9 children. Three of her children are in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Virginia has an internet cafe business in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase computer supplies.

Virginia has been in this business for two years. Virginia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase computer supplies.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 47 years old and married with three children.

Yolanda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Yolanda has been in this business for eight years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Yolanda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 53 years old and married with three children.

Eva works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like saop, can goods, noodles, egg, etc..

Eva has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from buy and sell herbal medecine.

Eva aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like saop, can goods, noodles, egg, etc.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jessica works hard to support her family.

She has a furneture making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Jessica is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like wood, nails, etc. for her furniture making business.

Jessica has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like wood, nails, etc. for her business

loans.name: Merceditha

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Merceditha works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from faming sugarcane and selling vegetables. Merceditha is borrowing PHP 40000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like can goods, soap, milk, sugar, coffee, chips, etc. for her general store business.

Merceditha has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like can goods, soap, milk, sugar, coffee, chips, etc.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Nida works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Nida is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy more grocery items to sell can goods, soap, shampoo, spices, etc. for her general store business.

She is successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store.

Nida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell can goods, soap, shampoo, spices, etc.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica is a forty year old married woman with three children living in Kasese,Uganda.For four years she as been an accountant and with the proceeds she has been able to buy land for farming.She was inspired by the conduct of other people in the profession and her vision is to become a certified public accountant.Jessica intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Esau

texts.en: Esau is a 31 year old married man with 5 children. He deals in produce where he earns a living from and apart from that he practices farming. He is asking for a loan to buy more produce. He faces a problem of price fluctuations but hopes that one day he will build a permanent house.

loans.use: To buy more produce

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en: Sulaiman is a hardworking married man living in Bundibugyo,Uganda.He operates a retail shop along side coffee and cocoa growing to boost his income.A good father that he is,he has been able to educate his children despite challenges of inadequate capital and unpredictable weather changes which affect his out put.His personal desire is to educate his children up to the university while business plan is to trade in wholesale.Sulaiman intends to use the loan to buy general merchandize such as salt and sugar to sell.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy general merchandise like sugar, salt and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Chris

texts.en: Chris is a hardworking married man with three children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has been running a retail shop and he started the business in order to meet his family daily expenses.With the proceeds he has been able to build rentals and pay fees for his children despite challenges of inadequate capital which is a big set back to his business.Chris will use the loan to buy general merchandize such as salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandize such as salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Rapheal

texts.en: Raphael is a forty two year old married man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda.With a dream of constructing rentals and educating his children to higher levels of education,he decided to start a retail shop and he has been in business for three years.Price fluctuation and lack of enough capital are his major challenges .Rapheal is requesting for a loan to add stock like, rice and suger to his business.

loans.use: to add stock like, rice and suger to his business.

loans.name: Mbusa

texts.en: Mbusa is a twenty seven year old married man with two children living in Kasese,Uganda.For ten years he has been operating a bar business and with the proceeds he has been able to educate his children and buy land for farming.Price fluctuation and high cost of rent is his major set back while his dream is to own a depot that supplies the whole western region of the country.Mbusa intends to use the loan to buy beer and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Elena

texts.es:
La Señora. Blanca des hace algún tiempo que forma parte del banco comunal Futuro para un Bienestar y en este grupo ha llegado a establecer buenos lasos de amistad con todas las socias del grupo. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad guarda su historia y mantienen intacta su arquitectura colonial, la gastronomía de esta ciudad es variada y cautiva el paladar de sus visitantes, su gente es amable, gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Blanca tiene 47 años, es separada de su esposo pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 27, 25 y 19 años de edad, sus tres hijos son casados y viven independientes. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Blanca se dedica a la venta de especierías desde que se caso ya que su suegra le motivo y le enseño este negocio, este negocio le ha permitido mejorar la estabilidad de su hogar y sacar adelante a su familia. 

El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de especerías del cual obtuvo buenas ganancias. Esta repitiendo el crédito ya que necesita comprar clavos de olor, orégano, canela y otras especias para continuar en el negocio. La banca comunal le gusta por los benéficos que recibe y la atención personalizada de su promotor de crédito.
texts.en:
Blanca has been a member of the “Futuro para un Bienestar” (A Future for Well-Being) communal bank for some time now.  She’s established good bonds of friendship with all the group members.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city that safeguards its history and keeps its colonial architecture intact.  The city’s cuisine is varied and delights the palates of its visitors.  Its people are kind, courteous and keep their culture and traditions alive.

Blanca’s 47-years-old and separated from her husband but while married had three children who are 27, 25 and 19 years of age.  Her three children are married and live independently. She does not own a house; she rents.

Blanca has worked selling spices since she got married since her mother-in-law encouraged her and taught her the business which has made it possible for her to improve her home’s stability and to move her family forward.

She used the money from her previous loan to buy spices which produced good profits.  She’s repeating the loan because she needs to buy clove, oregano, cinnamon and other spices to stay in business.  She likes the communal bank because of the benefits she gets and the personalized attention she gets from her loan officer.

loans.use: to buy cinnamon, star anise, cloves and other spices.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 59 years old and married with two children.

Anecita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like bread, cooking oil, snack foods, canned goods, laundry soap and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Anecita has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns additional income from hog raising.

Anecita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like bread, cooking oil, snack foods, canned goods, laundry soap and other groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Patricia

Patricia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to re-stock her store with food and household goods like soap, shampoo, can goods, noodles, etc.

Patricia has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Patricia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: tore-stock her store with food and household goods like soap, shampoo, can goods, noodles, etc

loans.name: Belinda

Belinda is 48 years old and married with 5 children.

Belinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Belinda has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eleven years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Belinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.name: Reginald

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Reginald works hard to support he family.

He has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Reginald is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to  buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell for he buy and sell charcoal business.

He successfully paid back her previous loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her buy and sell charcoal and general store business.

Reginald has been sustaining her business activities through his past nine loans from NWTF. He hopes that his hard work will help his attain his dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additonal sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 63 years old and widowed with 5 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Consolacion is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Consolacion has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jesil

texts.en:
Jesil works hard to support one kid. She is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Jesil requested a PHP 4300 loan through NWTF in order to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Jesil is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy solar lamp.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is 42 years old and married with four children.

Rosalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase food and household goods like coffee, creamer, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods, soft drinks, etc..

Rosalyn has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Rosalyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase food and household goods like coffee, creamer, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Robelyn

texts.en:
Ma. Robelyn is 34 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Ma. Robelyn is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to pay's for laborers salaries and buy additional fertilizers for her farm.

Ma. Robelyn has been farming sugarcane for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay's for laborers salaries and buy additional fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Belmore

texts.en:
Belmore is 57 years old and married with four children. With one child currently in school, Belmore works very hard to provide for them.

Belmore runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like rice, snack foods, canned goods, soft-drinks, laundry soap, etc. in his general store.

Belmore has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, snack foods, canned goods, soft-drinks, laundry soap, etc. 

In the future, Belmore would like to save enough money so he can afford to send his child to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like rice, snack foods, canned goods, soft-drinks, laundry soap, etc. in her general store

loans.name: Cesaria Rosalia

texts.en:
Cesaria Rosalia is 54 years old and married with seven children.

Cesaria Rosalia is in the agricultural business, farming banana in the Philippines. Cesaria Rosalia requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

Cesaria Rosalia has been farming banana for nine years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Perjolen

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Sara works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and general store. Sara is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to buy different kind of vegetables to sell for her buying and selling vegetables business.

Sara successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her buying and selling vegetables and general store.

Sara has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy different kind of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Cashaloma  (Nabón) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Cashaloma está integrado por 3 socios y 5 socias quienes viven  por los alrededores del cantón Nabon, este lugar goza de una exuberante belleza natural gracias a su geografía accidentada  y es de clima frió, la principal fuente de ingresos son la agricultura y crianza de animales. Su gente son personas que mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, tiene un corazón muy cálido y son personas trabajadoras que luchan día a día para mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Blanca, está realizando su segundo crédito a lado de sus amigas y vecinas del banco comunal Cashaloma, vive por los alrededores del cantón Nabon, el banco comunal le gusta por la unión y compañerismo de todas sus integrantes.

La Señora Blanca tiene 36 años, es madre soltera de 5 hijos de 18, 9, 7, 6 años de edad, su último hijo de apenas 8 meses, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, también estudia en un colegio los fines de semana, sus tres hijos están estudiado en una escuelita de la localidad. La casa en la que vive es propia.

Doña Blanca se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y a la cría y venta de borregos, cerdos, gallinas y cuyes, también siembra hortalizas las mismas que las vende en su comunidad.

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono, semillas y alimento para sus animales. 

Su meta es comprarse un terreno para crecer en la agricultura.
texts.en:
The “Cashaloma” communal bank has five female and three male members who live around Nabon Canton.  This place is of exuberant natural beauty thanks to its jagged geography and cold climate.  Its main sources of income is agriculture and animal husbandry.  Its residents are people who maintain their culture and traditions.  They are very warm-hearted and hardworking people who strive day to day to improve the economic stability of their homes.

One of the group members is Blanca.  She’s taking out her second loan together with her girlfriends and neighbors in the Cashaloma communal bank.  She lives around Nabon Canton and she likes the communal bank because of the unity and togetherness of all the members.

Blanca’s 36-years-old and a single mother of five children who are 18, 9, 7 and six years of age; her youngest son is barely 8-months-old.  Her oldest son works and helps her out economically and also attends high school on weekends.  Her three other children attend the little local school.  She owns the house she lives in.

Blanca does her household chores and also raises sheep, pigs, chickens and guinea pigs; she also grows vegetables that she sells in her community.

She will use her loan to buy manure, seeds and animal feed.  Her goal is to buy herself a parcel of land to expand in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds and animal feed.

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul is single without children. He is 42 years old and lives in Poblacion 4, Clarin.

Raul sells a variety of products to earn a living, and has had this business for ten years. Each month, he earns PHP 20,000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Raul has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, he hopes to save in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud y Vida. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Nancy tiene 59 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad, tres de ellos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es agricultor. Ella hace varios años atrás aprendió corte y confección en una academia en la ciudad.

Doña Nancy es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre le ha gustado salir adelante por sus propios medios, ella es  modista y tiene un pequeño taller de costura en la parte baja de su casa en la cual también tiene surtida una tienda de víveres de consumo. Allí es donde pasa casi todo el día realizando sus obras y atendiendo a sus clientes,  sus hijos le ayudan cuando ella tiene mucho trabajo ya sea en la tienda o en sus confecciones, en temporada de inicio de clases tiene mucho trabajo ya que elaborar muchos uniformes para ciertas escuelas de la localidad.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar telas y víveres para abastecer su tienda. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe.
 
Sus sueños son que sus negocios crezcan cada día más y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the Salud y Vida communal bank meet every fortnight. This place is known for its traditional culture and for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province - San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Nancy is 59 years old, married and has 4 adult children, three of whom still live with her. Her husband is a farmer. She learned dressmaking at an academy in the city several years ago.

Nancy is a very hardworking woman who has always liked to get ahead on her own. She is a dressmaker and has a small sewing shop in the downstairs part of her house that also has a grocery store stocking consumption goods. That's where she spends most of the day doing her work and serving her customers. Her children help her when she has a lot of work either in the store or on the clothing. In the season when classes start up again she has a lot of work as she makes a lot of uniforms for certain local schools.

This loan will be used to buy fabric and supplies to stock Nancy's store. She has been part of the communal bank since it began and enjoys the benefits she receives.
 
Her dreams are that her businesses grow every day and she has good health.

loans.use: to buy fabric and supplies.

loans.name: Sawe Rahayu Indah Group

texts.en:
Because the prices of feed are high enough, the Sawe Rahayu Indah group requested a loan for a higher amount. Each member gets 2,000,000 IDR. The loan will be use to buy superior quality piglets and feed.

Ni Komang is using the loan to buy two superior piglets and quality feed. To reduce costs, she still gives the feed mixture. She hopes the pigs will grow healthy and are not attacked by disease.

If she already has enough savings to venture capital, she will raise pigs with her own capital.

loans.use: to buy two superior piglets and quality feed.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 2 filhos que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É negociante vende produtos diversos e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (feijão, cervejas, refrescos, óleo, e outros), para aumentar e a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja ampliar o seu negócio construindo um estabelecimento comercial, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é de se empenhar mais para obter mais rendimento e realizar todos seus projectos
texts.en:
Rosalina is married and has two children who attend school. She lives in a house that she owns and doesn't support anyone else.
She's a merchant who sells various products. With the current loan she intends to purchase goods (beans, beer, refreshments, cooking oil, etc.) in order to stock up on merchandise.
Her wish for the future is to expand her business by building a store. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is working harder so that she can obtain more profits and accomplish all her projects.

loans.use: to purchase goods (beans, beer, refreshments, cooking oil, etc.) in order to stock up on merchandise.

loans.name: Anafina

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 2 filhos ainda menores de idade, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É negociante vende produtos alimentares e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (arroz, peixe, óleo, amendoim, e outros), para aumentar quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja ampliar o seu negócio para satisfazer os clientes e concluir a obra da sua casa, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é se empenhar mais para diversificar a mercadoria e vencer a concorrência no mercado.
texts.en:
Anafina is married and has two underage children. She lives in a house that she owns and doesn't support anyone else.
She's a merchant who sells foodstuffs. With the current loan she intends to purchase goods (rice, fish, cooking oil peanuts, etc.) in order to stock up on merchandise.
Her wish for the future is to expand her business in order to satisfy her customers, and also finish the construction work on her house. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is working harder so that she can diversify her merchandise and beat the competition.

loans.use: to purchase goods (rice, fish, cooking oil peanuts, etc.) in order to stock up on merchandise.

loans.name: Angela

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 2 filhos todos maiores de idade, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É negociante vende produtos alimentares e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (frangos, arroz, óleo, farinha, feijão, e outros), para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja ampliar o negócio diversificando mais a sua mercadoria, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é de criar mecanismos de tornar o seu negócio mais sustentável.
texts.en:
Angela is married and has two children, all of whom are adults. She lives in a house that she owns and doesn't support anyone else.
She's a merchant who sells foodstuffs. With the current loan she intends to purchase goods (chicken, rice, cooking oil, flour, beans, etc.) in order to stock up on merchandise.
Her wish for the future is to expand her business by diversifying her merchandise. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is creating ways to make her business more sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase goods (chicken, rice, cooking oil, flour, beans, etc.) in order to stock up on merchandise.

loans.name: Ángela Teodora

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud Y Vida. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 56 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha tenido dos hijos, los dos son mayores de edad pero su hija menor vive con ella, su marido es chofer.

Doña Ángela tiene un pequeño comedor en el centro de la ciudad. Trabaja todos los días desde las 5h00 hasta las 14h00, solo preparar desayunos y almuerzos  y su especialidad es el pescado apanado y los mariscos en general, a sus clientes les encanta sus platos por lo cual la prefieren, su hija le ayuda en su negocio  y son más de 15 años que tiene este negocio y le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar arroz, pescado, gaseosas y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho.
  
Su sueño es tener su propio local ya que donde tiene su restaurante es de su suegra.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto the communal bank Salud Y Vida (Health and Life) meets every fifteen days.  This town is known for its traditional culture and for being a few minutes from two of the greatest beaches in the province, which are San Jacinto and San Clemente.

This is where Señora Ángela lives.  She is 56 years old and has a common law marriage out of which she has two children.  They are grown but her younger daughter lives with her.  Her husband is a driver.

Doña Ángela has a small diner in the center of the city.  She works every day from 5:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. just to prepare breakfasts and lunches.  Her special is breaded fish and seafood in general; her customers love her dishes which is why they prefer her.  Her daughter helps with the business.  They have had more than 15 years with the business and it is going very well.

This loan is to buy rice, fish, soda, and other provisions in order to prepare her food.  She is a founding member of the communal bank and likes it because the loans help them a lot.  Her dream is to have her own business locale because the place where she has her restaurant belongs to her mother-in-law.

loans.use: To buy rice, fish, soda, and other provisions.

loans.name: Tatiana Del Cisne

texts.es:
La Señorits Tatiana está realizando su quinto crédito en el banco comunal Sentimientos, le gusta este grupo por el compañerismo, unión y carisma de todas las integrantes de este hermoso grupo, vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, tiene una belleza tanto natural como colonial, su gente aun mantiene viva la llama de su cultura y su gastronomía.

La Señoritas Tatiana tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y está muy emocionada ya que esta embarazada,  vive con su hermana en una casa arrendada.
 
Ella es oriunda de la provincia de Loja y vive hace algún tiempo en la ciudad de Cuenca a la cual vino por estudios, se encuentra estudiando el último año de Odontología en una universidad de la Ciudad, para tener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta por catalogo de ropa y cosméticos. 

Su nuevo crédito va a invertir en la compra de ropa y cosméticos, también va a pagar la matrícula de sus estudios.

Su meta es graduarse y realizar un postgrado.
texts.en:
This is Tatiana's fifth loan from the Sentimientos communal bank. She likes this group because of the companionship, bonds and charisma of all the members of this wonderful group. She lives in the centre of the city of Cuenca. Since December 1999 this city has been a Cultural Heritage Site. It has as much natural beauty as colonial beauty, and its people still keep the flame of their culture and cuisine alive. 

Tatiana is 24 years old, single, and is very excited because she is pregnant. She lives with her sister in a rented house.
 
She is a native of the Loja province. She came to Cuenca to study, and has lived here for some time. She is studying the last year of dentistry at a university in the city. To have her own resources she works selling clothes and cosmetics from a catalogue.

She will invest her new loan in the purchase of clothing and cosmetics, and will also will pay the tuition fees for her studies.

Her goal is to graduate and do a postgraduate qualification.

loans.use: to pay university tuition fees and to buy clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Mayda Antonia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Esperanza.

En este lugar vive  la señora Mayda, tiene 43 años, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos dos hijos de 20, 17 y 8 años de edad, todos estudian en universidad, colegio y escuela. Su esposo tiene una lubricadora y lavadora de carros.

Doña Mayda junto a su esposo se dedican al negocio familiar, ellos tienen una lubricadora y lavadora de carros, él se encarga de realizar dichos trabajos y ella se encarga de vender lubricantes, aceite, llantas entre otros repuestos de carros.  Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00  hasta las 18h00 con la ayuda de dos personas más a quienes les pagan un sueldo mensual. El negocio tiene más de 40 años ya que era negocio de los padres de su esposo y  su suegro se los heredo, esto les permite salir adelante con un negocio ya de tradición en su familia.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar llantas, lubricantes y repuestos de carros. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace más de 15 años  y le gusta por los beneficios que le dan en la institución. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
In the city of Santa Ana, known for its breathtaking views and its beautiful pools of fresh water which are visited by many tourists, the members of the New Hope Communal Bank meet every 15 days.

In this place lives Mayda, who is 43 years old and married.  She and her husband have three children ages 20, 17 and 8, who study in the university, high school, and primary school.  Her husband has an oil change and car wash business.

Mayda and her husband work in the family oil change/ car wash business.  Her husband is in charge of completing the aforementioned tasks and she works selling the lubricants, oil, tires, and other spare car parts.  She works everyday from 8:00am to 6:00pm with the help of two other people, whom they pay a monthly salary.  The business has been around for more than forty years since it was the business of her husband's parents and her father-in-law left it to them.  This allows them to move forward with the business that is already in the family tradition.

She will use this loan to purchase tires, lubricants, and spare car parts.  She has been part of the communal bank for more than 15 years and she enjoys it because of the benefits the organization provides.  

Her dream is that her children become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase tires, lubricants, and spare parts for automobiles.

loans.name: Abigail María

texts.es:
La Señorita. Abigail está realizando su primer crédito en el banco comunal Sentimientos al cual fue invitada por su hermana. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, tiene una belleza tanto natural como colonial, su gente aun mantiene viva la llama de su cultura y su gastronomía.

La Señorita Abigail tiene 18 años de edad, es soltera y vive con su hermana, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Ella es oriunda de la vecina provincia del Cañar pero llego a la ciudad para dedicarse a los estudios, sigue la carrera de Diseño textil y Modas en una universidad de la ciudad. Para solventar los gastos de sus estudios hace muy poco tiempo se dedica a ser instructora de baile y también se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. 

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos. 

Su sueño es ser una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Señorita Abigail is on her first loan in the communal bank Sentimientos (Feelings), to which she was invited by her sister.  She lives in the city of Cuenca.  This city is from the December 1999 Cultural Heritage of Humanity; it has as much natural as colonial beauty and its people still keep alive the flame of their culture and cuisine.

Señorita Abigail is 18, single, and lives with her sister.  They do not have a house of their own which is why they rent.

She is a native of the neighboring province of Cañar but came to the city to devote herself to her studies; she continues the course of Textile Design and Fashions in one of the universities in the city.  In order to meet the expenses of her studies she very recently started making a living as a dance instructor and by selling cosmetics.

She is going to invest the money from her loan in the purchase of cosmetics.  Her dream is to become a good professional.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Kushinga B Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 45-year-old Lionah from Harare. She is married with three children, all attending school. She also looks after two dependents. She runs a poultry business and knits jerseys for resale. The business has been in operation for four years. She says the main challenges being faced are stiff competition with other sellers and the cold weather, which affects the chicks. Lionah has requested a loan of $750 to buy chicks and chicken feed. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase the family's income and will hence lead to improved welfare. In the future, Lionah plans to keep large batches of chicks and own a jersey knitting shop.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Sinignessigui  Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe  SINIGNESSIGUI II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelle à  LOBOUGOULA, un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (SIKASSO).
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : riz  avec ROKIA  1 ere à droite de la photo à position assise.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et payer les frais de labours  pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 190 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi de réinvestir le reste dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Sinignessigui II group are married women, who average 50 years of age with five children each, and who all live in traditional families in Lobougoula, one of the villages in Mali's third administrative region (Sikasso).

They collaborate with the microfinance instituiton, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to be able to carry out successfully their farming activities during the winter months. They are on their seventh farming loan with the institution and all their previous loans have been repaid in full. 

Rokia, who is sitting on the far right of the photo, grows rice. With her loan she is is planning to buy fertilizers and pay labor costs for the maintenance of a hectare of land. Once it has been harvested, the crop is sold to a customer base made up of men and women.

She expects to make a monthly profit of 190,000FCFA per season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and she will reinvest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to pay labor costs and purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Sabasta

texts.es: La señora Sabasta, es una persona de 30 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, alcanzo a estudiar hasta la primaria, actualmente no cuenta con dependientes económicos, su actividad económica principal de la señora Sabasta es la agricultura, produce los siguientes productos anualmente: papa 76 cargas, oca 20 cargas, haba (verde) 12 cargas; estos productos son producidos en los terrenos agrícolas de sus padres sin costa alguno en un superficie de aproximadamente 4 has, los cuales cuentan con riego y es aplicado por inundación, los terrenos agrícolas están ubicados cerca a la población de Tíraque. Vive en la casa de sus padres, que es de tipo rustico, en el cual cuenta con servicios de agua potable y luz, por otro lado la Señora Sabasta manifiesta ser una persona trabajadora y responsable que quiere superarse económicamente en la vida  y para tal efecto se ve en la necesidad de solicitar capital de operación para la compra de material de construcción, de tal forma poder mejorar su vivienda y porque no decir también la calidad de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Sabasta is a single, 30 year old person. She has a primary school education. Currently she does not have dependents. Her principal source of income is from farming. She grows the following crops every year: 76 loads of potatoes, 20 loads of oca (an edible tuber) and 12 loads of broad beans (green). These crops are produced on her parents’ farming land at no cost at all. The farmland covers an  area of approximately 4 hectares, which are irrigated and flooded. It is located near the town of Tíraque.

Sabasta lives in her parents’ home, a rustic structure which has potable water and electricity.  She says that she is a hardworking and responsible person who wants to succeed economically in life. Consequently she finds that she needs to request operating capital in order to purchase construction materials so that she can improve her dwelling and also her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 40-year-old married woman. She is the mother of five children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband started his own business selling fuel eight years ago.

Rubina is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan to increase his supply of fuel so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. He also wants to save money for his children's education. Rubina hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase fuel to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and cloth for a sewing business

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Group

texts.en: In the year 2013, four young ladies from a tribal village named Basuguda in the Rayagada district of Odisha, India formed a Joint Liablity Group called Maa Laxmi to take house-repairing loans from Mahashakti Foundation. Kumari is the featured member of this group. The young lady standing second from left with a raised hand is Kumari. Kumari is 30 years age and lives with her husband and three-year-old son. All the members of this group are marginal farmers with small pieces of land. Kumari’s husband works on his agriculture farm where he cultivates cotton and pulses (legumes). Kumari works in a rice mill as a daily wage earner. From the small income of 4,000 INR per month, Kumari barely manages all the expenses of her family. Due to this poverty situation, as of today they have not been able to build a good house. With her present loan, Kumari wants to purchase cement, bricks, etc. to renovate her mud house and create another room for her family. The other three members of her group are Bilasini, Sujata and Kasai who are also planning to modify their houses. All the members of this group are very happy with this good inventiveness of Mahashakti Foundation.

loans.use: To purchase cement, bricks etc.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 39-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband started his own business selling silk thread eight years ago. He makes the thread himself and sells it in the market.

Shakeela is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan to increase his supply of threads so he can respond quickly to his customer's needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Shakeela hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase fabric to make thread to sell

loans.name: Erdenetsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Erdenetsetseg, 41 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. She has been selling raw materials such as iron ore, coal, trees, cotton and plastic since 2006. Her daughter studies at college, where professional cooks prepare students for cooking. Her 4-year-old son stays at home. Her husband has been rendering transportation services to local people since 2007 and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in this service. 

The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years and needs some serious repairs. So Mrs. Erdenetsetseg is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 tugriks to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass, shingles and foam. Using these materials, she and her husband can repair and insulate their house. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, emit less smoke and contribute to the efforts against air pollution. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Alpedita

texts.en: Alpedita is living in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is a 44-year-old married woman with four children. To earn a living, Alpedita owns and manage a sari-sari store offering goods in the community. She borrowed 5,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to purchase dried fish and bagoong (a fish-based condiment) to sell.  She plans to expand her business to have multiple incomes in the future.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish and bagoong to sell

loans.name: Sinignessigui  Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe SINIGNESSIGUI III sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelle à  LOBOUGOULA, un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (SIKASSO).
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec AWA  au milieu de la photo position débout.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et payer les frais de labours  pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 120 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi de réinvestir le reste dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
The SINIGNESSIGUI III  group consists of ten married women who are, on average, 37 years old and also have an average of four children each.  They all live in traditional families in Lobougoula, one of the villages of the third administrative region of Mali (Sikasso region).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully complete their farming activities during the rainy season.  They are on their seventh farming loan with this institution, and all their previous loans have been duly repaid.

Awa (the featured borrower) cultivates groundnut.  In the photo, she is in the middle of the standing row.  She plans to use her loan to buy farming inputs and to pay for the cost of plowing on one hectare of land (2.47 acres).

After the harvest, Awa sells her crop to men and women, in her village.

She is expecting to make an average profit of 120,000 CFA francs per season, an amount which will allow her to repay her loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and to buy farming inputs.

loans.name: Salomon Lino

texts.es: Según sus vecinos, personas allegadas y colegas del Señor Salomon indican que es una persona humilde, actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres, tiene 43 años de edad, necesita del presente préstamo para poder refaccionar el techo de su habitación y así poder evitar cualquier percance que puede sufrir el inmueble, el Señor Salomon nos indica que es técnico en contabilidad pero que no ejerce su profesión, sino que este trabaja de electricista por más de 7 años; de estado civil separado, hace más de 6 años cuenta con un hijo, quien depende de su apoyo moral y económico. Hoy solicita el préstamo indicando que le será de gran ayuda ya que en épocas de lluvia su casa  sufrió deterioros y desea refaccionarlo con el fin de poder estar más tranquilo y de esa forma tener mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
According to his neighbors, people close to him, and colleagues, Salomon is a modest person. Currently lives in his parents home. He is 43 years old and needs this loan so that he can repair the roof of their home and this way avoid any damage to the property. 

Salomon tells us that he is an accounting technician, but that he does not practice his profession. Instead he has worked as an electrician for more than seven years. Separated, for more than six years he has had a son who depends on his moral and financial support. 

Now he is applying for the loan, saying that it will be a great help to him, as in the rainy season their home suffered damage and he wants to repair it so that he can have greater peace of mind and greater comfort.

loans.use: To repair the roof of his home.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: El señor  Juan Pablo, es un señor de 26 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos dependientes a su cargo, el señor  Juan Pablo trabaja en la actividad de la producción de leche cruda en la ciudad de Cochabamba, donde tiene 2 cabezas de ganado lechero en producción y 2 cabezas de ganado preñadas, y la leche que produce vende a las señoras del lugar. La casa donde vive el señor  Juan Pablo es propia, el señor  Juan Pablo vive con sus padres y el destino del nuevo crédito es para la compra de ganado vacuno, ya que con la compra de una cabeza de ganado lechero aumentara la producción de la leche y por ende aumentara los ingresos por entrega de leche.
texts.en: Juan Pablo, 26, is single and doesn't have any children in his care. He works producing raw milk in the city of Cochabamba, where he has two heads of dairy cattle in production and 2 heads of pregnant cattle. He sells the milk that they produce to the women in his town. Juan Pablo owns his home and lives with his parents. He will use the new loan to buy new cattle, since with the purchase of another head of dairy cattle he can increase his milk production and thereby increase his income from his milk deliveries.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es originario de la comarca Los Potrerillos en las afueras de Teustepe, casado, tiene 8 hijos de los cuales  4 hijos están casados y 4 hijos a cargo  solo  el menor de 17 años estudia su 4to año de secundaria en el instituto del pueblo cerca de la comarca. Él se dedica a cultivar maíz, frijol y trigo hace 40 años, a los 15 años lo hacía al lado del papa quien le enseño todas las labores agrícolas pero también hoy en día  trabaja como albañil y con dicho ingresos a ido mejorando su casa y comprando sus vaquitas. Para realizar sus trabajos de siembra y recolecta del maíz, frijol y trigo lo realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos aunque muchas veces tiene que pagar un mozo para terminar rápido la jornada, la cosecha la vende en la misma comarca para evitarse gasto de transporte.  
 
Hoy don Juan está solicitando este crédito para comprar los fertilizantes, abonos, pago de mano de obra y la semilla del frijol y maíz para la siembra. También dice que el crédito le será de ayuda ya que podrá comprar la semilla y los insumos para realizar los trabajos de siembra y sacar  a tiempo una producción de calidad. Juan dice que al cancelar este crédito buscara otro financiamiento para comprar un toro semental por el momento lo mas próximo es terminar de limpiar el terreno para que esté listo para la siembra del maíz y  frijol.
texts.en:
Juan is originally from the region of Los Potrerillos, which is on the outskirts of Teustepe. He is married and has eight children. Four of them are married and four of them are under the age of 17 and still in his care. Juan studied through the fourth year of his secondary level at an institute in a town near his region.

Juan has been growing corn, beans, and wheat for 40 years. At the age of 15 he worked alongside his father, who taught him everything about farming. He also works as a bricklayer and with his earnings, he was able to improve his house and buy cows. In order to carry out his work of planting and harvesting corn, beans, and wheat, he relies on the help of his children but there frequent times when he has to pay a laborer who can quickly finish the work in a day. His harvested crops are sold in the same region, which allows him to avoid transport costs.

Today Don Juan is requesting a loan so that he can buy fertilizers, compost, bean and corn seeds for planting, as well as pay for a hired laborer. He says that this loan will help him buy the seeds and supplies needed for planting, which in time will lead to a quality production. Once he repays this loan, Juan says that he will request another one so that he can buy a breeding bull. For the moment, he will finish clearing his land so that it will be ready for planting corn and beans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, bean and corn seeds, as well as pay for labor.
